Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Can't really fault it except it would be nice to have real milk provided with the tea/coffee making equipment in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Tulip inn”
Reviews.Author: stewart b Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: right in the heart of the city,hotel could not be better placed, yes it is a bit noisey due to the bells ringing from the old church, but had no trouble sleepin in a really comfy bed, room was neat & tidy with large modern bathroom. will be my 1st choice when going back to dam,

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: neilgilmour
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the city centre, only a 5 min walk from the central train station and everything you wish to visit is on your doorstop from this hotel. We stayed in room 316 and apart from the local church bells ringing had no noise at all. (anyone visiting amsterdam wishing to complain about church bells, should stay at home!!) The beds are really top class, I wanted three pillows on my bed, not a problem, delivered within 5mins of asking. Bathroom was modern and came with soaps/ shampoo/shower gel things. We were given the room at 11:40 so managed an early check in and got a late check out on the day we left, so can not find any fault with this hotel or the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here”
Reviews.Author: Gis R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I expected much more from this hotel We had to swap rooms twice due to dirty beds and noise and were very disappointed by the bad state this hotel is in Great location, but they need to thoroughly redesign everything inside

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in room 29!”
Reviews.Author: Fred T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would give cleanliness, rooms and overall rating a 5 star had we not had to wait an extra 2 hours to get into our room on the Friday. When we finally got our room i found the carpet on the floor by the bathroom to be wet, I put a towel down on the ground to soak it up and when i lifted the white towel the was what looked like mold and something else disgusting soaked into the towel. The window did also not open as it was on the ground floor. The room (room number 29) did not look a thing like the pictures on the website. Bed was OK but everything else was pretty substandard. we expected a lot more for the price we paid. We complained in the morning and the woman at reception was very helpful and changed our room right away. The new room we were given was a lot better, bathroom very nice, no disgusting mold patch on the carpet, windows that open etc... if they would have put us in this room in the first place it would be 5 stars all round. We would stay again but not for the price we paid, and DEFINATLY NOT IN ROOM 29. they should totally renovate the bathroom and change the carpet, so it is in line with the other rooms it if they are going to rent it out. We felt cheated to be put in the room when we could have been in a far nicer/cleaner room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deepthinker22
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried when our friends booked this hotel for our trip to Amsterdam as the reviews on here are not all 'glowing'. How pleasantly surprised were we? The hotel was extremely well run and clean and every member of staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Special mention here to June who was the man on reception for most of our stay - could not have been more helpful! We had two rooms between us and they were both completely adequate. They were clean and both the actual bedroom and the en-suite were a good size. We had rooms 304 and 306. They possibly could have done with a bit of updating but the hotel is being renovated a bit at a time so I guess they will get to them. Our rooms were cleaned every day and there were tea/coffee and a kettle in the room. Breakfast was very good. At least 4 cereals, various different breads (and a large toasting machine), at least two cheeses, at least two cold meats, hard boiled eggs, croissants, pain au raisins, pain au chocolats, fresh fruit, jams and marmalades. On the hot side there was sausage, scrambled egg, bacon and mushrooms. Also teas, coffees and fruit juices. We never used the bar but did look at the prices and they were not much different from other bars so certainly did not look like rip off prices. As I say, reception could not be more helpful, allowing us to drop bags early, leave them there on check out day, offereing advice when asked and we heard them booking trips for other guests. The hotel is a bit of a rabbit warren in that you cannot get away from the fact that it used to be four separate buildings so there is a bit of up and down stairs to do to get to rooms. For example we took lift to third floor, walked along corridor, up one small flight of stairs, up another smaller flight and then down a small flight! Our room faced away from the street and was quiet. The clock that others mention was in ful view and chimes beautifully but I am an insomniac and I know for a fcat that it di not chime all night - seems to stop after 11 and start again around 7. Our friends room faced the road and was a bit noisier but as I have said in previous reviews of hotels, if you book a hotel in the centre of a city is not going to be like being in the middle of the country. The hotel is exceedingly close to the red light district and this sadly does mean that in the morning you leave the hotel amongst the rubbish left scattered on the ground that the council have not got around to clearing up yet. I guess this might put some people off but all in all I would have no problem recommending this hotel provided you accept that it is a city centre hotel and that not all tourists treat the area with respect when it comes to litter. In summary, I think it was a very good value hotel with a good range of food at breakfast, pleasant staff and there was always a large bowl of sweets on reception too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great value!”
Reviews.Author: Superguest
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with some trepidation, but as we were only staying for 1 night I was more bothered about location than luxury. I was pleasantly surprised on arrival - NO funny smells in the reception area or rooms. Spacious room (118) that was spotlessly clean looking out over the front of the hotel. The bathroom looked quite new and had plenty of hot water. You have to realise that this is NOT a 4 star hotel and you are not paying 4 star prices. The location was perfect. 5 minutes walk from the centraal station, steps away from the Damrak with all it's shops and restaurants and just around the corner from the lively red light district. As a first timer to Amsterdam I was a little concerned that the hotel was practically in the red light district, but I needn't have worried as we walked around we felt really safe and it wasn't as seedy as I expected. The only negatives I could find were that there was some noise from the church bells and delivery vans etc early in the morning, however as you are smack bang in the middle of a capital city this is to be expected. Also there was a cigarette burn in one of the chairs in the room which made it look tatty. Minor gripes and the location made up for any of the negatives. If I were to go back to Amsterdam I would return to the Tulip Inn.

Reviews.Title: “stay away..”
Reviews.Author: Tsandnes
Reviews.Content: Book another hotel.. It smells funny in the reception, and in our first room the smell was unbearable, we then got another room. The hotel is very worn out and does really need a renovation! We did not get a lot of sleep because of noicy neigbours. The location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “been staying here for over 40yrs”
Reviews.Author: Wrighter69
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel [formerly the Terminus] Great location for shops/station/ and the Red Light Dist [my main reason] lol !! Never had a problem here with anything, friendly staff ok, maybe the breakfast is a bit plain, but im never up in time to eat anyway

Reviews.Title: “All you need!”
Reviews.Author: Tommylennon1987
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights here. Hotel staff lovely & helpful! Room was huge for the 3 of us with lovely comfty beds. Can't fault hotel, yes it looks a little tired. But for the money you get a lot! Very close to everything. 5 minute walk from central station. Red light 3 minutes away. Must eat at wok to walk! I will definitely be returning to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the hotel was brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Clare B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I Have stayed in this hotel twice now and I am going back again in June. The staff are very helpful and the hotel is clean. I can't fault this hotel in anyway ! You have a flat screen tv that you can buy movies from and the movies are very good !

Reviews.Title: “Tulip Inn Amsterdam Centre”
Reviews.Author: davidcalderbank
Reviews.Content: I have stayed the this hotel before, the location in excellent only ten min walk from Central Station, the hotel is need of a refurbishment, the carpet in the reception is very dirty there is a really big light feature in hotel reception I counted 13 bulbs had gone its sounds a bit petty but they need standards....... the carpets on the corridors where very dirty and badly stained, but what a pleasant surprise went I went into my room (219) the carpet looked new with only a couple of stains but not offensive, a new bathroom suite and a large shower and always hot water, I would stay there again and would request room 219, all the hotel needs to do is concentrate on the cleaning of public areas, breakfast was ok nothing to complain about and the staff was friendly

Reviews.Title: “my room was good and rate was good value”
Reviews.Author: wouter Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The key card was reused which is ok if they clean it, mine was dirty and I washed it in the sink with the soap. Yikes, it was gross and I am generally not picky. The room however was very clean and the beds are good I got a very good night of sleep there. If I come back to amsterdam I would stay in that same room again. Room 306 or any of the higher up rooms away from the street side.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.....average everything else”
Reviews.Author: HonestRedReviewer
Reviews.Content: So as the title says - great location. A 10 minute walk from Central Station, so very impressed there. Got into our room early (about 1pm) which was also good.Room was on the small side but looked clean and cosy. The following morning it emerged that the shower head was just jammed behind the rail which it moves up and down on as the bracket was broken. Not only that, but the was no hot water. On the way out, and due to the 89 euro room rate, we deemed this worthy of reporting and getting sorted. On giving them the option of repairing or putting us in a different room, we were immediatly offered another room which we could move into straight away. I got the sense that that repair was never going to happen and they were going to chance how many people took issue with it (or not!). They offered to show us the alternative room, which was huge and had a great bathroom etc BUT was on the ground floor (windows looked out over one of the streets in the city). As it was midweek, we said okay and moved room. Still was noisy a bit at night so would definately not recommend doing at the weekend. Didn;t bother with brekkie as it was overpriced (as many of them are). So in summary, i think i was just about satisfied. The location outweighed the problems, but i'd give the room a thorough check before getting unpacked!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel shame about the city”
Reviews.Author: H k
Reviews.Content: when i 1st booked this hotel i was a little frighted about what i had just booked the pictures made it look like a right dump with the scary picture of the girl on the steps must have been took in 1994 so when i arrived i was surprised in a good way. the 1st thing you hit is the smell in the reception not so nice so maybe a little spray would do the job but the rooms a fine we were in a big room for 3 people which was right beside the lift but didnt hear a thing the beds were very good the only annoying thing was the church bell which went off every 15 minutes, the little sweets in reception were lovely a nice little touch the staff were very helpfull when we were leaving there was a very rude american guest who was going off at the man at reception about something that he had missed placed even at one point he started talking Spanish to him but the man behind the desk kept cool the whole time! the best thing about Amsterdam is the train out of the city to the airport, oh and the new library very nice indeed and it sells lovely banana smoothies. i found Amsterdam a dirty whole and will never be back it has nothing to do apart from the things you have heard off. my eyes have been opened to sights i have never seen before. i thought there was bound to be more to the city than the 'dark' side but really it hasnt !! if you want a central hotel the tulip inn is perfect, and the little dog outside that sits is soo friendly :)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, but quite expensive for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you are looking for ...”
Reviews.Author: AnnieM27
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a clean, reasonably priced, centrally located hotel for 2 nights in January 2012 and that is literally what we got. The room was up a tiny, thin (typical Amsterdam) old staircase and we were in an almost "attic" up from the second floor. It wasn't easy climbing up that staircase with luggage! .. The room was a little depressing (small, a little like a box) but it was clean and the beds were ok (although the bottom sheets were too small for the mattresses. We looked right out the back onto the old church where the bells chimed constantly every 15 minutes - but maybe it was because we were very tired - but they really didn't bother our sleeping at all. Location wise it was excellent (if looking for a central location) ... everything in Central Amsterdam was a short walk away. If I wanted to spend more I would have of course preferred a more upmarket hotel - but for what we paid, for the location we were in and for what we were looking for in our 2 nights it was fine ..

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms and pjuke on the carpet”
Reviews.Author: Ballonsimon
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and can not recommend it. The room smelled and the bed sheet was dirty. The overalle impression was bad. maybe ok if you are backpacking but the price of 70Euro is way too much

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced”
Reviews.Author: Georgia2751
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from Amsterdam and the Hotel Tulip. The location was great except that I found it difficult to find the hotel - it's in a small street. I kept getting lost although on day 2, I had it sorted! OK., I very impressed with the staff - friendly and helpful. No complaints there. The room was basic but clean. Didn't get much sleep as the mattress was so soft and the walls were paper-thin and you could hear everything that was going on next door (too much information, if you see what I mean...) The price was hugely inflated for what is really a one star hotel. Let's be honest, 60 quid for a single room there was ridiculous. Although, having overheard a conversation in reception, you may get it cheaper by booking direct rather than going through online booking agencies. I changed to the Eden Hotel on the second day and was very pleasantly surprised. Huge difference in standard, got a gorgeous room for exactly the same price. Just wish I hadn't pre-booked the Tulip!!

Reviews.Title: “Be ready to find a surprise in your bed...”
Reviews.Author: JeroenBudapest
Reviews.Content: In need of a place to spend the night on 31 Dec., we took whatever was available. In this case it turned out to be a rather steep price (about 200 Euro) for a hostel quality room. The introduction was memorable: Once we got the key to our room, we entered,... only to find other people in our beds! For the rest: small, noisy room, no plug for the bath tub, a full mug of cigarette butts placed in full view outside the window, a thick fog of pot smoke in spite of the hotel's 'no smoking policy'. Good bed, though.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay!”
Reviews.Author: dncnqueen
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I realized I had booked at the wrong hotel. The hotel is very dated and the lobby smelled terrible. Being told that we were the last to check in, apparently we got the worst room as well. The room smelled like cigarettes although it's supposed to be a non-smoking hotel, part of the bedding was missing and there were tiles broken all over the bathroom floor. The water coming out of the bathroom sink was not drinkable and smelled of sulfur and the safe in the room had been permanently locked. When we approached management, they pretty much shrugged their shoulders and said they couldn't do anything about it. Since the room was paid for in advance, we had to stay. The room was rather large but reminded me of a spring break accomodation and not what was advertised. The location is on the edge of the red light district, which is great but as the room has no AC, you have to leave the windows open for air and there's a ton of noise at any hour of the day or night. Definitely not staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: AlexE22
Reviews.Content: Only thing posetive about this hotel is its location. Terrible service, terrible reception area and terrible rooms.. Not happy at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location average stay.”
Reviews.Author: David1101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location! It is just a few blocks from Central station and easy to get to. The hotel is right on the edge of the Red light district if you take a wrong turn you may see more than you care to, so don't take your kids. My room 21 was bigger than average hotel rooms in Amsterdam with a big size bathroom. This is rare for central hotels. Down side is that the room had no view - window opened into the light well. The bathtub was glorious to soak in after a long day on my feet. The sink was a little scary with burn marks and questionable stains. I wanted some sand paper and Ajax. Extra for internet access which is just a rip off. Did not eat here as breakfast was extra but there are lots of coffee places within a block or two. Honestly I would only stay again if the price was really, really good. Otherwise spend a few bucks more and you have better choices. If you just want to sleep there and spend your time in town 'n museums etc. it is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs renovation asap!”
Reviews.Author: nassos
Reviews.Content: Having booked through Groupon (an agency in Greece), I wasn't sure what I would meet... The fact is that after having spent two wonderful weekends in Amsterdam in the last year, having made my decision of a hotel through the positive reviews at tripadvisor, it was the first time I let sb else decide for me where to spend my night (the agency..). The hotel is near to the central station, and that is the only advantage it has... It is an old hotel (it was called Terminus as I saw opening the 'empty' and old refrigeraton in the room) that the chain Tulip Inn maybe has forgotten its existence... We arrived at 14.00 o'clock in Friday afternoon and were given room 231. The room was very small and from the window you could hear the noise from the road that is sees in the Red Light District...Think what would happen if we stayed there for the night.. We complained immediately, and they gave us room 12, which was on the road on the side way, but it was a little bigger, but it didn't have any sound proof.. You could listen to anything that was happening on the road in front of the hotel.. Thankfully, due to the fact that near the hotel was the police station, not much happened... The sheets that covered the matresses just covered the matresses and it was funny that in the morning I realised that i was half sleeping on the matress, without any sheet on it... The room was dirty, could not say with confidence that they have cleaned it thorougly... Anyway, the breakfast was ok, but I wouldn't say I will miss it... The location is 'great', you are at the beginning of the red light district, and you have more than 20 coffee shops near you... I will be more cautious when picking hotel, or agency (Groupon) next time...

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: bruss533
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for luxury this is not for you. However, traveling on a budget, we found this hotel to be clean, the staff to be pleasant and accommodating, and the location of the hotel to be perfect. It is a short distance to Central Station which was important to us, and yes it is on the edge of the Red Light District which is so clearly marked that it is easy to avoid. However, it is not at all scary and as it turned out our favorite pub was just inside the district. Our very small twin bed room had no TV (out for repairs), and when I went to the front desk to report this as unacceptable we were upgraded to a 2 story room at no extra charge. The downstairs had a modern bathroom, desk, armoire, upstairs were the beds and a flat screen. I was delighted with this upgrade. We walked to everything we wanted to see, close to pubs, shops, museums, and Dam Square where there was a carnival going on!

Reviews.Title: “Tulip Inn Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Coco B
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this shabby city centre hotel which is located at the side of the red-light district. Our room overlooked one of the streets in this area. The room was dark, even with the lights on, It was impossible to read once it got dark. The whole hotel was shabby , tacky and uninviting. There was a disgusting dirty looking sofa, in our room and chunks of plaster out of the wall. Breakfast was poor, lots on offer but of inferior quality. The staff were very nice friendly and helpful. This was an extremely expensive hotel for what was being offered.

Reviews.Title: “If luxury's not your thing...”
Reviews.Author: Xerys
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, admittedly due to its convenient location to the Centraal Station which can easily be walked with luggage if neccesary. Turned out the hotel is situated just around the corner from the Red Light District and the Damrak not too far off. There are pubs nearby serving meals and also a supermarket with a good selection of take-away-and-heat-food if you instead prefer that. Location therefore cannot be faulted. If you have rented a car, there is a parking garage literally up the road so this too made the hotel even more convenient but parking though was a pricey EUR50.00 for around 11 hours (Sep 2011 prices). While check-in is quick and fuss-free the staff struggled to understand English which is somewhat strange given that most people in Holland speak fluent English. There is wi-fi in the lobby area but it is not free. Wi-fi in the rooms are apparently a problem from what I could make out from the reception staff. Luggage storage is provided too. The hotel seems very much a group hotel for international tour operators as groups were coming and going at intervals. Depening on the location it can be tricky to reach your room as it feels the hotel has plenty of levels and annoyingly the lift did not work. This made lugging heavy luggage really difficult and not helped by the many fire doors and stairs. The rooms are far from luxurious. Basic, clean and relatively comfortable if somewhat small. For a stay of up to two, three nights it will suffice at the price if you are not a guest house kind of person. Not sure about the laundry facilities either.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: twinkles
Reviews.Content: A very nice and eclectic Amsterdam Hotel--up a staircase, around a corner, down half a staircase, up two staircases and around the corner, there is your room. I loved it. I spent one night here and dont remember much because it was all coffee shops all the time. I highly recommend this place if you want to be in the most action packed area of Amsterdam and like a friendly attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “You really do get what you pay for!!!”
Reviews.Author: blockbuster2008
Reviews.Content: The only plus point is that it has a central location which is good for those who like pubbing and clubbing. Other than that I'd avoid this hotel like the plague! The hotel layout is nothing short of a maze for some rooms and were a complete nightmare to find following a night out drinking. My room itself was functional although the stored spare pillow was covered in stains and my room was facing the church bell across the road that rang on the hour every hour!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rowlandCheltenham
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for one night. After reading the reviews on this site we found the place to be clean and just what we needed. The room was better than expected and on the 2nd floor. The stairs are quite steep but there is a lift. Breakfast was nice and very dutch, (well it is Amsterdam). The location, only 5 minutes from Central Station and just on the fringe of the RLD. Two minor faults is the bells from the oude kerke church but these are silenced during the wee hours and no plug for the sink or bath, we didn't bother saying anything and next time in the Dam will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: JimiHalifax
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nights in room 358 a quad. Everything all right, comfy beds, no frills, cleaned and new linens every day. Renovated bathroom, its just a place to sleep. Hotel smells kind of musty when you enter. Staff was fine, friendly and accomodating although we were pretty low maintenance just some guys enjoying the area. If you're looking for a place very near RLD and you are not too fussy its fine. Older clients or families I would not recommend. No safe in 358.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spot, mediocre quality”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed A
Reviews.Content: i stayed in Tulip inn City center for 3 nights with a friend. The staff gave us 3 different rooms that were terrible until we finally settled on the 4th room we saw which was a severe upgrade from the previous ones. The staff are sneaky and trying to save the few good rooms for special guests. The staircases are narrow and its definitely not luggage friendly internet is not free which was a surprise for the steep price we paid. overall i doubt i would be returning to Tulip Inn again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Location ok, Hotel basic and tired”
Reviews.Author: JanckieandIan
Reviews.Content: Hotel was chosen for proximity to Central Station, no issues there. Hotel in serious need of some money spent on it, very tired looking. We had the softest bed ever experienced, not comfortable at all, room in poor state of repair and bathroom door and wall had holes in them.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but good location”
Reviews.Author: DuffManDublin
Reviews.Content: I had to saty in this hotel for one night while awaiting a flight the next day. The hotel is very basic and my singe room was tiny - probably one of the smallest rooms I have stayed in. I stayed room only, so did not have breakfast at the hotel. The only goo dthing about the hotel was the location. It was very central. You only had to walk outside the door and you were close to plenty of bars and restaurants. If you were on a budget maybe you could justify staying here for one night but I suspect there is better value to be had in other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What's The Problem?”
Reviews.Author: EwanMarshall
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews only after I had booked into the Tulip Inn and was expecting the worse. What I found was a very pleasant and comfortable stay. The hotel was clean and the location was bang in the city centre and ideal for moving around the city. I missed breakfast as I had to be up at the RAI for 7:00am so I'm unable to comment here. Please don't be put off by the negative reviews, some of which mention the tightness of the spiral stairs! You will find that this is typical in any of the older buildings in the city.

Reviews.Title: “I won't book with terminus again”
Reviews.Author: Niklas P
Reviews.Content: Extremely filthy room (Mouse poo in the room!!!) Plastic bags taped over the smokedetectors. Mould pretty much everywere. No airconditioning and it was very hot. However the location is great, but i won't stay here again, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Never be back-a disgrace!”
Reviews.Author: Phillip A
Reviews.Content: Hotel booked by our travel agent. On arrival we had to wait ages for help with bags. Room was in basement where no lift was available and stair case a health hazard. The room was small, dirty with stains on carpet and dust dirt and mould on walls. The room was over looked by two other rooms with only privacy with curtains closed, that is when we attended to the hanging hooks. There was no air conditioning which required us to open a small window (by standing on the bed) which exposed us to smells and noise. The bathroom was outdated and STUNK making us feel sick. The Hallway leading to our room had a distinct musty/mouldy smell. The TV could not be adjusted for a half decent picture. The continental breakfast was sparse for 20 Euros cost with equipment (toaster) in a poor state of repair. Quality and choice of food was poor. Tea and coffee facilities were sparse with no implements to even stir the coffee! Probably the height of poor service came when we checked out and asked for someone to help with bags (no lift and a steep dangerous staircase) to be told in no uncertain manner that they had no-one to help!!!! The only tick I could give it was location - that is if you consider being next to the red light district a plus. All in all soured our opinion of Amsterdam. Wake-up Tulip Inn and just follow your documented service standards!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the feint hearted!”
Reviews.Author: djkennyt
Reviews.Content: We booked The Golden Tulip on line, but when we arrived, we were told that we were "At The wrong hotel" then despatched off to The Tulip Inn, on the other side of Dam Rak. Friendly Staff on reception, we were given a ground floor room over looking a street which was very noisy and busy most of the day & night. The room was basic, carpet was dirty, a former guest had been sick on the carpet and up the wall which was not cleaned. The breakfast staff were rude and the room was very busy, we were directed to a back room, an extension of the room, very dusty and dirty, but the breakfast itself was good. The hotel has wi-fi but not free, I was charged 5 euro for 1 hour, don't think I'll book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen1981
Reviews.Content: After seeing the reviews on here i was more than a little apprehensive about staying in this hotel, but I have to say I have nothing but good things to say. My partner booked a trip to Amsterdam as a surprise for my 30th Birthday. We were checked in smoothly, was given a great room (11) which was clean, comfy and big!! The staff were all courteous and very friendly. Will definitely be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: BenniHupp
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location. The Hotel couldn't be closer to the red light district of Amsterdam, yet it is on the outskirt, so there were no noise complaints in our room. We shared a 4 bed room, which was small and simple. Cleanliness was ok, but again we stayed in this hotel because it was a cheaper alternative at a great location. I would recommend this Hotel for a family though.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel I'm Afraid”
Reviews.Author: Alternatives
Reviews.Content: The thing that saved this hotel for us is that we had functioning air con in our room. Otherwise, it would have been a very unpleasant two nights as this hotel is in a very busy, noisy part of the historic Dam Square area. Don't know how they were awarded 3 stars, which they certainly could achieve if they invested in some sound proofing and decent air exchange system. Also, I had thought the Tulip Inn brand stood for higher quality than this hotel currently provides.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: happyslynch
Reviews.Content: Having seen the reviews online, I knew this hotel would not be 5 star, but I did not know that it would be dirty! The room, which was "deluxe" had a broken fan, stains on the rugs and chair, moldy grout in the tub, and a view into the neighbors room. The hotel was virtually impossible to manuever due to mulitiple staircases, and it was set on a back alley. I changed hotels during my visit, and still have yet to receive a refund to my bank account for the difference. In addition, I have attempted to contact the hotel several times and let's just say that their "customer service" (if you could even call it that) was sub-par. One receptionist has hung up on my several times!

Reviews.Title: “It's fine - did the job nicely!”
Reviews.Author: Jonny1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a trip to Holland with friends and needed a second night in Amsterdam as our original hotel was fully booked for our second night. It was round the corner from our original hotel so we didn't have to go far and check-in was seemless. The lady on reception said we had been upgraded, and our twin room (119) was ideal for what we needed. Big enough, comfy beds and a decent bathroom all clean. Also had a flat screen TV with a decent choice of channels. Breakfast was also good the next morning with a variety of choice - Sausage, Bacon, Scrambled Egg & Mushrooms or the more continental cheeses, hams, eggs, croissants etc. Location was also great, right next to Dam Square, the station & close to the Red Light district etc. Unless our upgrade made that much difference (felt like a normal twin-room) I don't quite get all the horrific reviews - but maybe we were just fortunate with our room!

Reviews.Title: “Makes a change to be pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Bigfella66
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on trip advisor I was very apprehensive indeed of this hotel booked via a stag company , however my worries were put to rest on arrival we were delealt with promptly and efficiently. We were given our room at twelve and not three as advertised. The only moan I could have would be the church bells which is beyond the managements control and dealt with via my own ear plugs and the breakfast could be better but what can you expect when abroad? In general a very good clean hotel in a very prime location

Reviews.Title: “Stinky, in many respects”
Reviews.Author: travelbee28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was as sketch as it gets. For 90-100+ Euros, I was appalled. You should know that it is smack dab in the middle of the red light district before going. In the first closet they gave me, the door did not shut unless it was slammed; the table and trashcan were broken; internet did not work; and the room was about the size of a shoe box. I complained and got sent to a larger room on the top level, which was quieter but had an outdated bathroom that stank to high hell. Suffice it to say, I cut my stay short and moved to the Eden Hotel, a few tram stops away, for about 30 Euro more. The difference was night and day!

Reviews.Title: “A truly awful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Pau109
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a more than memorable two night stay at the Tulip Inn, Amsterdam Centre, I feel it only appropriate to inform others of what is a truly awful hotel this is! Firstly the hotel is in a particularly good location. A five minute walk from Centraal Station and backing onto the Red Light District. You are less than five minutes from Dam Square and all the major attractions. This however is the only strong point for this hotel. We were greeted by a fairly pleasant enough receptionist who booked us in efficiently and directed us to our rooms. The hotel is made up of three or four converted houses that have been knocked together. They are all on different levels and there are several sets of spiral stairs that lead all over the place. Needless to say we got lost! Upon locating the rooms (263 and 264), I was amazed to see just how much could be crammed into a small space. I could easily touch both walls with both hands! There were two single beds laid out end to end with a wardrobe near the window containing a single broken hanger. There was a desk with a flat screen TV mounted above on the wall. The bathroom was truly spectacular. You could sit on the loo, have a shower and brush your teeth in the sink all at the same time. I am 6' tall and could barely move in there. Next comes the heat. The hotel was baking throughout, particularly the bedrooms. You could open the window, however this set you out onto a late night Irish pub no more than five meters away. The chanting from the various stag groups will ring in my ears for days. This of course continued throughout the day and up until 1am every night. Not that closing the window did much in any case due to the single glazing. For a hotel group of this size, one would expect an investment in double glazing by now, particularly when considering all the other reviews. Instead they offer two sets of ear plugs, something I have never seen in a hotel before. You will need to use these too, as not long after the pubs shut you get the singing drunks beneath the window followed by the chiming of church bells every half an hour and throughout the day. I quite honestly got no sleep for two nights. The beds are incredibly soft which may suit some. However, they are fitted with sheets that are too small and they ride up exposing the mattress beneath. Nevertheless the linen was all clean and changed daily. There were also some complimentary shower gels and shampoos. On the whole, I did think the room was fairly clean and if I was to be picky there was a huge mound of cigarette ends on the window sill. The TV showed a good selection of channels including pay per view movies. It also had internet access. You could get all the channels and internet for E19.50. This is all great until you try and watch the TV from your bed. It is mounted so high on the wall and so close that due to the angle you cannot see a thing. There was also a kettle with accompanying teabags and coffee, but no milk or cups! No iron or ironing board anywhere. Finally the best bit of all which was checking out. I was greeted by a very obnoxious woman who refused to call us a taxi and demanded payment for the TV despite me telling her that it was un-viewable. She was not interested at all in any of our problems and gave the impression she didn't want to be there, which is understandable given the the state of the place. To summarise, I would heed the advise of all the other reviewers on this site and avoid the place at all costs. It is exceptionally noisy, fairly run down and staffed by rude disinterested people. There are plenty of decent hotels in Amsterdam and this one is the pits. It advertises as a three star but I would give it two at best. You would be better off spending your money and staying in a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not do it to yourself”
Reviews.Author: Luiz_Sobrinho
Reviews.Content: What to say about a hotel that gives you earing protector? can you imagine the noise? Thanks God, we were lucky and stayed only two night, calm by the way, but it can be really anoying in the region. The staff does not want you there, they do not want to be there, they want to go away, only! It has good location? depends... after a short walk in AmsterdÃ£ you realize that could be better... it's close to Amsterda Centraal, but, unless you want to take a train and get out of there, it's pointless, better to go to some hotel closer to...a quiter place, if exist.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced could do with a major re-vamp”
Reviews.Author: Della C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the extended Easter weekend, and would quite honestly not stay there again. The initial rroms given were substandard to say the least, and after some vociferous complaining by our friends we were moved (upgraded?) to a business class room for the rest of our stay on the 2nd day. Initial complaints among others were cleanliness of the room, lights/.fridge not working, stained pillows, carpets & walls, toilet less than sanitary, and seat not worjking, and the air-con in our friends room poured with water all the time they were in the room All this for 145 euroa anight with no breakfast. The upgraded room was indded a vast improvement, but with its shabby chairs and marked distressed wallpaper, still left something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the service & quality of hotel/rooms!”
Reviews.Author: bazza1977
Reviews.Content: On arriving, there was actually no problem and the service was polite and as we arrived early, we were even offered a place to store our luggage before our room became available. However, on check in and throughout our stay, we had various different problems that we encountered from: - No coffee available in room, just decaf, when asked if we could have some, we were told that they didnâ€™t have any and that none would be available until â€˜next weekâ€™ - Dust absolutely everywhere - The windows were supposed to be double glazed but offered no noise reduction from the crowds in the street below (and the local church bells I might add), we were in room 311 - The penultimate night upon arriving in our room after an excursion, we noticed that no big (bathroom) towels were replenished and we only had 2 small hand towels between us, on asking if we could have some bath towels, we were questioned if we were sure that no towels were there and that sheâ€™d have to go and check. On checking, we were eventually given 2 towels with a comment stating â€˜the whole hotel is almost out of towelsâ€™! - The bathroom had mould in places - Paint and stains on communal carpet areas - The water pressure was inadequate and at times completely ceased to a dribble - The shower connection was not working and we had to maintain one hand on the shower tap in order for the water to run through the shower instead of the bath tap - The air vent kept coming off the bathroom door - The room temperature gauge was held on by cello tape Now I understand that some of these are things that can happen at any time, but we would think that things like, dust, mould, etc. would be on the list of things to maintain as a matter of hygiene, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, do not accept room 18 though!”
Reviews.Author: mazwiz
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here 2 nights last week during our trip to the dam. We pretty much think the same as most of the other reviews, the location is excellent, easy access to everywhere you would want to go, and being so close to the red light district is great, specially for a walk about at night. We were given room 18 when we arrived, and were pretty dissapointed when we walked in. Small, dark, but clean enough. The toilet didn't flush, just ran all the time, and there was loads of banging from above. We are usually really easy pleased, but my boyfriend couldn't sleep so asked to be moved. We were told we were below the entrance to the hotel, hence the banging, and they wud move us the next day when another room became available. When we did get moved, to room 214, we were very pleased. It was bigger, had a window that opened, and tea/coffee making facilities. We noticed tho that our card had 'complimentary upgrade' written on it, which meant they had given us a better room, and I'm guessing that will be more expensive than a basic room, but definitely worth it! We didn't eat breakfast (we enjoy long lies on holiday!) but there's 2 places right next door that do a lovely fry up! Expensive, but everywhere in Amsterdam is! I would stay here again, just not in room 18!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: N0pp3
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and have to say that location was the best part! Rooms were ok, breakfast was good and service overall good. One big minus was a mouse in our room in the middle of the night eating my chocolate! We got a new room where no mouses were seen but couldn't also get good sleep either (because I was waiting when the mouse will come.. :) Church bells ring every 15 minutes from 7 am to 11 pm, but that did not bother me so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: Averagejo2020
Reviews.Content: If you want a decent hotel in near the red light district then this is well worth a look, we stayed there as a group of 15. Yeah the place is a little tired but it's cheap so it's to be expected! Pro's - The breakfast was good, central location, close to dam square, red light district, round the corner from the grasshopper pub. Neg's - There is a church with a bell ringing near by from 8am, you will hear it and don't expect a lye in, the rooms are a little dated and compact. The Lift is rubbish, a guy got stuck in there whilst we were there!!

Reviews.Title: “nice but basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandBean
Reviews.Content: located in the quieter part which is a bonus, very secure hotel, rooms standard but clean.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hayley-NI
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend are just back from Amsterdam after a 4 day stay. We stayed at the tulip inn and found nothing to complain about. As soon as we arrived in reception (which looks to have new carpet recently laid) we were greeted my a friendly receptionist and given the key cards to our room. We used the elevator to reach the 3rd floor. When we entered the room it was lovely and clean and bigger than what we expected. The room had new carpet aswel and the tiles in the bathroom were free from mould and looked recently regrouted. And the beds had clean linen and there was definitely no bed bugs! We also had a safe in our wardrobe. They also supplied ear plugs, a sewing kit and a shoe polisher. And there was a flat screen tv attached onto the wall. The only bad thing about the hotel is the clock bells that ring every 15 minutes but we fell asleep with no bother every night and never got woke up because of them. The hotel is situated just behind a large building on the main street and is a 2 minute walk from the train station. Because it's so centrally located we walked everywhere - the Anne Frank house, torture museum, ice bar, hard rock cafe, etc. On a map a lot of the attractions seem a long walk but they're not! The maximum we had to walk was around 20 minutes. However watch out for the maps you get from your hotel or on the back of a leaflet they're all different from eachother and place the attractions in different places its quite confusing we had to use a combination of 4 maps! Oh and one last thing I read a review on here about having to pay extra for breakfast...we didn't pay anything and had breakfast everyday!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER NEVER AGAIN WOULD WE STAY IN THIS HOTEL,A DUMP......”
Reviews.Author: flomck
Reviews.Content: Never ever again would we stay in this Hotel or would i ever recommend it to any one. Its the first hotel we have ever stayed in that supply EAR PLUGS in your bedroom. The bed is one of the worst beds that we have EVER TRIED TO SLEEP IN. And the NOISE GOOD GOD thats all i have to say ,ITS A DUMP ....

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a lads weekend”
Reviews.Author: xavred
Reviews.Content: The Tulip Inn is situated just on the edge of the red light district - the perfect location for a stag weekend. It's great value for such a location & is in reasonable condition in comparison to some of the slum hotels in Amsterdam. The hotel is not suitable for a romantic break or a family break.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel with one warning”
Reviews.Author: MickSamOz
Reviews.Content: DO NOT use the phone in the lobby. This is the only way of making international calls in the hotel and it charged our credit card almost $100 for a 10 minute call to the US. (No rates advertised on the phone itself)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Terminus - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geordie-Kate
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here about the hotel, i was not looking forward to staying here but once we got to the hotel my opinion changed. The hotel staff were helpfull and the room was lovely and clean, we didnt here any noise. The Location was fantastic right next to the Grasshopper, and about 5-10 mins walk to the Red Light District and the shops are just around the corner from the hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: WMulgrew
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, was noisy at night, but room was clean and staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible noice!”
Reviews.Author: Travellel
Reviews.Content: Any review of this hotel has to be dominated by the terrible noise. If your room is on the Red Light District side, you will probably not be able to sleep at all. Although the rooms are otherwise new and renovated, the windows are not and therefore keep no noise out. The partying in the pubs and clubs continues till early morning. If you have to choose this hotel, bring very good earplugs. The room itself was clean and functional, although quite small. The toilet was very good and new - probably just renovated. The hallways of the hotel were in a poor state of decay and notably dirty. The lobby was ok. Breakfast was not included in the high price. Service was ok, but not enthusiastic. All in all, because of the very central location, the hotel would be worth staying were it not for the noise. Of course, if you have come to Amsterdam to party all night, then the hotel may be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel AVOID!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adele32
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband have just returned from a 3 night break in Amsterdam. Although we had a great time the hotel terminus was a bad choice of hotel to stay in. Although we expected some noise, we didnt expect to be awake all night!!!! The windows are old and have no glazing that would help some of the sound problems. There was bad damp in the room with brown water leaking down the walls (which hadn't been cleaned up) The radiator didn't work and the room was very dirty and had minium lighting VERY GRIM!!!!!! They were having new carpets fitted in the reception area during our stay which was like a death trap with loose carpet hanging off the stairs yet no sings were put up or no word of warning from hotel staff. I suffer with bad asthma and with the damp and dust felt awful after the first night so complained and asked for a new room without damp. The reception staff laughed and said most rooms have damp, when I asked about the radiator she laughed agian and said none of them work but hadn't informed us when we booked in. They did move us to a new room which was a little better but still awful (no damp). I would'nt normally write a review but am really cross with the service at this hotel and regardless of what if cost (our stay was 310 euros) it should be clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: AnOpinionBreda
Reviews.Content: hi everyone, I baught a giftcertificate for my mothers birthday and tried to book this hotel, which advertised to be joined. I called to make reservations and the person who i spoke to was very rude and uninterested to help. She spoke to me like i was unimportant. This attitude you will see often in Amsterdam. I love Amsterdam, but in hospitality they are not the best. I told her it was for my mothers birthday and she gave me numerous reasons why it wasnt possible to book (when she didn't even listen to what my real problem in booking was).. she just guessed and wanted to get rid of me. I am not booking there obviously, because i want a little bit of class and hospitable people welcoming me in to their hotels. What a shame..

Reviews.Title: “Bad first impression...but overall OK”
Reviews.Author: edenLancs
Reviews.Content: My face dropped when we walked into this hotel - it looked like a hostel. The carpet on the floor of reception looked dirty and the first impression (especially after reading TripAdvisor comments) was grim. However... (i) the reception staff were efficient (..not particularly friendly, but efficient). (ii) Our room was quiet and clean with a great en-suite bathroom which looked new. Other room slightly more noisy as at front of the hotel. (iii)Breakfasts were in my opinion OK, but husband and son thought they were good. (iv) Location is good for sightseeing. The hotel does appear to be undergoing a phased rennovation - but lets hope the owners read this and get rid of all the horrible carpet in the public areas and instruct their staff to clean the hall, landing and staircase more often. This hotel could be so much nicer for not much more effort...

Reviews.Title: “central location - but do not expect three star quality”
Reviews.Author: business_travelller
Reviews.Content: hotel is located within minutes to the Amsterdam Central Station which is very convenient due to current construction of public transportation system in Amsterdam the rooms to the front side of the street ( Beursstraat ) and to the back side of the hotel ( Warmoestraat ) are very noisy. Do not expect to get some quiet and/or any sleep before 2 AM in the morning ! Did stay several times in this hotel and the rooms do not have an airconditioning system. Escpecially in the summer it gets very hot and humid in Amsterdam and if you end up in a room located to the streets, you can not have the window open due to noise. Last time ( room 258 ) the window was only possible to open for a gap of 10 centimeters ( no hook, no nothing ) and the outside temperature was around 30 degrees celsius ! Do not expect too much from this hotel by the description, it is just simple and basic accomodation, sometimes highly overcharged rates ! The advantage of this hotel is the central location. Thats all of it. Unfortunately !

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: dromack
Reviews.Content: Good location in the heart of Amsterdam, near Central Station. Triple room very nice and quiet. Hotel clean. Very steep and narrow stairs to the upper floors. Check in and check out very fast and smooth. Friendly staff. Unfortunately, the high price of how the three-star hotel without breakfast. In addition, I recommend the excursions of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Mice and mouse poo...”
Reviews.Author: Stiina-80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotels for five nights in June 2010. The first impression was ok, the view was to the chirch and the room was upstairs. At first night me and my friend woke up because of strange noice coming from our room. That night we did not surely see anything, but in the morning we found mouse poo on the table and our cookies were eaten. We complained about this to the reception and they offered us another room, practically next to the our first room. We did not want this other room, because it was smaller and the mice were still coming also from the corridor. So we asked if someone could come to our room and clean up the poo (during the morning cleaning the poo was left on the table), the receptionist said that we have to wait until next morning. Next morning the poo was cleaned up (because we asked), but not after that. The mice visited us every night and there were more poo every morning and nobody cleaned it. We tried to block every hole in the room, also the hole under the door, but the mice were still coming. So, we could not sleep well for the whole trip. Mice were not afraid of noice or lights. I can never recommend this hotel to anyone. We stayed at room number 311.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service”
Reviews.Author: Mulkis
Reviews.Content: Hotel reception is very slow, makes many mistakes. Offered Car Hotel service for the car. They takes car and brings you NOT on time. Does not try to understand, smiles and tells you to call to director. Waste of time! And I think reception just forgot to call for the service in time.

Reviews.Title: “zero customer service.”
Reviews.Author: LOVE002
Reviews.Content: We were initially happy with this hotel, as 7 young ladies we felt it was safe, clean and hospitable. This soon changed. Two of the group came back to the hotel one night to find a mouse running across our beds in the one room.....they reported this straight away to the receptionist Patrick who then came up to see for himself. Patrick refused to do anything about this and pretty much turned his back on the two girls. The girls then contacted the rest of the group and we returned to sort the problem out. We wanted to be re-roomed or at least get a refund for the night we wouldn't be sleeping in that room. Patrick was apparently the ONLY member of staff on the premises and told us that he was unauthorised to do anything about the room. After 2 hours of heated arguing , patrick finally rang a manager who told us that the hotel did not give refunds , no matter what. We were not allowed direct communication with the manager, we were refused by patrick to speak on the phone to him ourselves. Another hour passed by and we were offered a room across town for half of us to stay in...finding this unacceptable we were told they would no longer help us or speak to us and the seven of us would have to stay in the 3 bed room we had. Needless to say this was absolutely ridiculous and very very uncomfortable. When we approached the actual manager in the morning he offered us 40 euros back after another hour of debate. The manager actually walked away from us several times. Due to the fact that we were going to be late for our flight, we finally agreed to have a 70 euro refund ( not even a third of what we had paid ) . We found the staff to be incredibly rude and unhelpful , they used offensive language towards us and turned their back on us. I 100% do not recommend this hotel. Not only were there mice...money also went missing from the rooms after housekeeping had changed the sheets. Absolutely Disgusting. The place should be shut down.

Reviews.Title: “mouse in our room!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rebecca_8_5Uk
Reviews.Content: we arrived at this hotel it was fine good location our first night sleep was ok although no hairdryers like it said just wires hanging from the wall. second night we arrived back late around 2 went to relax in our room only to find we have a "little friend" yes a mouse! so we went downstairs to complain the staff member didnt really seem bothered he came to check out the mouse and yes he to spotted the mouse! to which he just shrugged his shoulders and said the hotel was full so we couldnt be offered another room, we had other friends staying at the hotel so we asked for there room key to which he handed over with no questions asked......... we realised that when our friends came home where would they sleep??????? buy this time our friend were speaking to the receptionist and he really didnt seem to care they argued for 2hrs to try get a room all he offered was a room which he had moved 2 other people out of because of severe damp he seemed very reluctant to contact his manager finally he did at 5am to which we were offered another hotel across town by this time we were very tired and had to be up to check out the next day 11am so we decided it was to late and this should of been offered in the first place not as a very last option! through the whole time the receptionist did not apoligise once! we all went to bed 7 of us in 3 beds the next morning we spoke to the big boss then the infamous "manager" he didnt apologise he just said there is a mouse in every home an hotel room in amsterdam............................hmmmmmm ok then, an then he decided to blame us for eating in the room although we ate out we had been in the room for all or a few hours to change an shower! we told him we wanted a refund for the one room for the one night as we didnt use it! but he would not budge he offered a taxi to airport 40 euros we paid 175 euros for that room for one night with a mouse!! after a further hour of arguin (wasting out last day in amsterdam) the guy finally got it that we wanted an apology yes so he apolgised and only offered 70 euros we were fed up so we took the money and went to enjoy our day but with only 3 hours sleep it was hard. The service at this hotel is terrible if you like mice and bad customer service this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Red Light District and Central Station Proximity”
Reviews.Author: FormerTravelAgent85
Reviews.Content: The Terminus is a basic hotel, but clean and well located to access the Red Light District and Central Station (handy if you are arriving late at night or after a long train journey, as it is less than 5min walk to the hotel). If you can get a decent rate of around US$100 per night then this is a great value hotel featuring large, comfortable beds, clean bathrooms and a modern television. I would stay here again, we felt safe even late at night and were happy with the standard and service.

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: robinpots
Reviews.Content: we arrived one day late due to ash cloud. on arrival we were informed that our room was not available and after our protests we were allocated what must have been the worst room we have ever occupied. small somewhat triangular room with dirty curtains and windows that we were unable to open. the bathroom was unclean and without ventilation. after further difficulty we got a transfer to a 'superior room' on day three. this room was recently decorated and ' superior' when compared to the hovel we had occupied days one and two. however, there was no shower tray and the water flooded the floor to within 10 inches of the doorway so we had to stand in the bedroom to dry ourselves. the wet bathroom floor presented problems for a large part of each day.

Reviews.Title: “The location is the only redeeming factor”
Reviews.Author: kingdombrunel
Reviews.Content: Neither my partner nor I are particularly fussy about hotels, it's just somewhere to sleep/shower when we're not out exploring. Having said that, for what we paid for three nights in this place, I expected more. The staff were bordering on rude and barely spoke to us or made eye contact. There had been a fire in the kitchen so no breakfasts were available for the duration of our stay (somewhat of a relief - I wouldn't fancy sampling the food since they don't even seem capable of operating a vacuum cleaner). The rooms are shabby and outdated, not to mention incredibly warm and the air conditioning is rubbish. The walls are thin so I got woken by the people next door having a shower and thought my room was flooding, it was so loud. There is a large bell tower outside that chimes every 15 minutes from 7am to 11pm. I am also about 90% certain that there was a mouse in our bedroom on the last night - I heard it and thought I saw it shoot across the floor but sadly couldn't find any evidence to enable me to get my money back! The photos on tripadvisor are too kind - the hotel does not look that good. My advice would be to keep looking for somewhere better to stay - there is bound to be somewhere for an equivalent price!

Reviews.Title: “Mind the front door - it will easily destroy your walks in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Javanainen
Reviews.Content: Only for a one-night stay I donÂ´t have many comments. The sadest thing happened immediately when stepping in. The persons in front of me let the door shut: it crashed to my ankle with not nice consequences. I could hardly walk for the whole trip. I made my compalint, but the staff seemed to know the problem with the door, but also announced their sceptism for anything to be changed. After this, I was not very fond of the hotel. However, one positive issue was the breakfast. The room - especially - the bathroom was a total disappointment. The room was downstairs behind the luggageroom. The hotel is just close to the church - it was nice to hear the bells ringing. Aferwards I changed to another hotel in the center and was very happy with it (close to Singel, in a very pieceful area).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mini9184
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I wasn't expecting much, I really thought it would be a dingy hotel without towels or shampoo.. Which, at the price I payed, would have seemed normal. What a suprise! Well sure it's old and the carpet is coming away in many places, but our room was very spacious and very clean. The bathroom was impecable as well, with clean towels, soap shampoo and shower gel. Our room had a cupboard, a safe, and a flatscreen tv, and as it was facing a little inner-courtyard, we didn''t have any noise from the streets. The staff was helpfull, and they keep your luggage during the day if you have to checkout in the morning but only leave in the evening. But the best part was the location, just 10m away from the famous "The Grasshoper" bar/restaurant/coffeshop, the only place to allow cigarettes joints and alcohol in the same place. By the way I recommend buying your joints at Baba down the road and taking them to the other places, as they have the best priced and best quality material. The hotel is also right on the border of the red light district, and within walking distance of everything (Central Station is 5min away). We walked from out hotel to the Heinekken Museum, the House of Bols (a must see), and to the VanGogh museum, it's very well located. Dam Square is down the road. I would definetly go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect a 3 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller22Wales
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from this hotel in Amsterdam. First of all the good bits. Location is very central, only 5 minutes walk from Centraal Station and is therefore easy to get to. However the hotel is close to the Red Light District and if you have an issue with this it may be worth looking at other locations. Upon arrival I was told I had a room in the basement and that they could move me tomorrow (not the most reassuring words upon arrival). However I went to look for the room to see what it was like. The room is down a set of spiral staircase and upon arrival in the basement there is a rather strong smell of damp. What you will also notice is that you share the basement not with other guest rooms but with cleaning cupboards and the sort. The room itself looks ok however it only has a small window looking out onto walls making it very dark and dingy in the room. The bathroom, although refurbished is very narrow. Some of the walls in the room are also damp as they had black marks on them which was starting to also affect the curtains. The advice from reception was to either open the window or they would put a fan there (not too sure how this gets rid of damp in a couple of hours?!) Reception were unable to do anything for me, however eventually I moved to a room on the third floor which was a vast improvement on the basement room. Reception were however very poor. None of them had any idea from one to the next what was going on making it very difficult to arrange a simple room change. To summarise, if booking this hotel don't expect a typical 3 star hotel beacuse it's not. To be honest, I've stayed in nicer hostels! And most importantly, if you have to stay here make sure you avoid room no 31 in the basement as this room really should not be sold out by the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel in great location-plesantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: blueraven1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went for a weekend in Amsterdam and we got this hotel pretty cheap.Having been to Amsterdam a few times,I was a bit worried,as the hotels aren`t gret,especially those close to the centre.I was really surprised with this one though! It was only a five minute walk from central station and right in the heart of everything.Shops,bars and restaurants are all in close proximity almost n the doorstep! It is right on the edge of the red light district.Don`t let this put you of,I felt completely safe walking to and from the hotel. We had a room at the very top floor,with a great rooftop view.As there was only 2 rooms on the top floor,there was no noise from other rooms.The room was a good size for 2 people,clean and comfortable,with a clean bathroom and bed linen.The street outside was a bit noisy but nothing to put us off sleeping.There is church bells ringing close by but its really not that often and its quite nice to hear anyway. The hotel staff were very helpful and polite and were happy to recommend things to do.I`m not sure about the breakfast as we never went for it(we slept in!). All-in-all this was a great choice and we got extremely lucky with the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saunders174
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam staying at the Hotel Terminus. The staff were excellent and always extremely helpful. The room size was fine as was the bathroom. The safe in the wardrobe was free and very useful.The condition of the room was OK. The breakfasts were of satisfactory quality with a much better choice than many hotels we have stayed at. The position of the hotel is a major asset as it close to the Central station and good for many other attractions. The only downsides were the dim lighting in the room and the noise at night. However both these were bearable

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: scribble00
Reviews.Content: having read the mixed reviews we weren't hoping for much from this hotel but from beginning end we had a very pleasant cosy stay in hotel terminus. whats not to like, perfect location, friendly staff, room lovely and bathroom very nice with great shower. i have no complaints at all and am rather surprised at the negative comments on here. the church bells didnt bother us at all, but for those light sleepers they provide you with ear plugs. there was a nice tele, free to use and also a fridge which was handy. round the corner from plenty of coffee shops and 5 mins walk to dam square and 2 mins away from central station. i would definately recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty. Nasty. Awful. Disgusting. Horrible.”
Reviews.Author: ANPNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: First off, I love Amsterdam. I have been there twice and it is one of favorite places. This hotel, however, had to be one of the worst places that I've stayed in my life. I have stayed in dozens of hotels in many cities, but this one may be the worst. I can recall worse service, but never a more horrible room. I stayed at the Terminus with my girfriend from July 25-29, 2009. We don't require luxury and lots of extras, but is a clean, quiet room asking for too much? The front desk staff were courteous, but not helpful in the least. The room had an overwhelming smell of disinfectant (not the most pleasant smell in the world), but still managed to look dingy and dirty. The bathroom was gross. We made the silly mistake of flushing the toilet and it was approximately 20-30 minutes before we were able to flush again. We complained to the hotel staff and they said that they would fix it, but nothing changed during our stay. The Terminus is centrally located, but almost too centrally located. There was a bar/pub that stayed open until god-only-knows what time and it seemed as if we were in the bar with the patrons. I'm from NYC--one of the noisiest places in the world, but this was ridiculous. The lighting in the room was dim (which was probably a good thing) making it difficult to see inside of the room. The hotel offered breakfast, but we didn't feel confident eating there since the hotel was filthy. In any event, Amsterdam has so many great breakfast options we weren't too concerned with breakfast at the Termius. Although we would have loved to spend another week or so in Amsterdam, we were thrilled to leave the Terminus. I have no doubt that there are 10 youth hostels in Amsterdam that are far superior to the Terminus. Simply the worst. Don't stay at this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Bed BUGS !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EDW12
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to this hotel together with my wife in our first trip to Amsterdam and Holland. We took our time to plan our three days visit of the city, but for the choice of the hotel, we relied on the advice of our (ex) travel agency. At the hotel we were given a relatively small room; the furniture was outdated, but still functional, and the walls required fresh painting. Nothing special so far. However, waking up after the first night at the hotel was special: the sheets were covered with large blood stains, my wife and myself had bites everywhere, and round fat insects were moving all over the sheets. We did not know what kind of insects were those, as we never saw them before. We started killing them on us, on the sheets, smashing them with the towels, acting with the febrile feeling of survival. It was gruesome. We took a shower, packed everything and left the room immediately. At the reception I shouted as loud as I could at the people there, making sure that everyone present hears me. I told them that they should burn down this filthy hole, where they canâ€™t keep elementary rules of hygiene. We checked out immediately, and called the agency to cancel the payment of the hotel. At the railway station we managed to find tickets on the spot, and left Amsterdam with the feeling that we will not come back. Home, I found out that these things are called bed bugs. It appears that they do not transmit contagious diseases, despite of the fact that they consume blood. I hope the scientists are right with this. This hotel is the worse hotel I have ever stayed! It ruined our holiday, we had to throw away a good deal of clothes (getting these insects out of them isnâ€™t that easy, and we wouldnâ€™t risk it), and it left us with the very negative feeling of having slept in a junk yard, while paying for it. So, as an advice, avoid this hotel, at all costs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spot on!!”
Reviews.Author: clairer30
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i stayed at the hotel Terminus on Sunday 9th November 2009 for 1 night. Location was excellent (I suppose this depends on where in the city you are wanting to stay) just on the edge of the red light district with plenty of shops and coffee shops on the doorstep. Just where we wanted to be. Very close to Dam square and a 5 minute walk from Central station. Perfect. Some people have commented on the church bells during the night. We stayed in room 13 right at the front of the building facing the church. Although these could be heard it never disturbed us at all and my husband didnt even notice them. The windows are double glazed and seriously dont worry about them you wont even notice. Our room was spacious and clean and the shower was fantastic. The bed was also very comfy. At the end of the day you get what you pay for. The tv/internet in the room is a great touch although i though â‚¬19.99 for 24 hrs was a little excessive. I think basic tv should be available for no charge but hey ho you dont go to Amsterdam to sit in your room all day watching tv. The communal areas could do with a lick of paint but all in all a great little hotel in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “A mouse with clogs on!”
Reviews.Author: DundeeMoe
Reviews.Content: Was an ok hotel. We had 2 attic rooms. One was facing a busy street and it got quite noisy in the wee hours of the morning! The other room my friends were in had o such noise but they had a little vistor on the last night we stayed there. It was a mouse! Ha, ha, ha glad it was them and not in my room. Breakfast was good, but the rooms were in need of updating. I really did'nt like staying quite so close to the "action" if I'm honest.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: dplcts03
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this Hotel to anyone.coz, everything is walking distance.resturant,coffee shop,bars,Museum,site seing and many more

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, decent”
Reviews.Author: Alittlebitofthat
Reviews.Content: The guy who checked me in was a bit arrogant and unfriendly, and first sent me to a smoking room even though i had booked a non smoking room, and said "no guarantees" when I went back to ask for a non smoking room. That first room I got was extremely smoky and pretty much uninhabitable for a non-smoker. The non-smoking single room I got in the end, while small, was quite nice. The bed is clean and comfortable (in which I ended up spending a lot of time reading a novel). There was a reading light by the bed, and the heater was cozily by the head of the bed, as well. I'm a bit of a clean freak and am sensitive to strange places, but there was nothing to complain about at all in this second room. A different Asian guy at the front desk was very nice, and opened up the already locked dining area for me on the night of my arrival to microwavev my market-bought refrigerated fried rice, and recommended that I go to Chinatown (right through the Red Light District; it is behind it) and spend equal money for much better food. That was what I did for the rest of the stay! The police station is right next door, so even though the hotel sits right next to the Red Light District, I felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “loveeeed it . . . .”
Reviews.Author: lala_boii
Reviews.Content: deadly hotel when we went we booked a different hotel but ended up moven to terminus was right in the middle of everything smoke shop right outside the door close to central station . when we checked in we got a choice of 3 rooms . staff were nice rooms were clean . beds were lovely . only problem its like a maze wit all the corridors but brill hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly dirty, incredibly ill-mannered staff”
Reviews.Author: iskandar339
Reviews.Content: Maybe this hotel -or better this dog-hole- was not that bad thirty or forty years ago. But now it is terribly dismal and wretched, the furniture is old fashioned and of bad quality and there is dust everywhere, especially on the carpet and curtains. Besides, I saw some spots under the sheet of my bed and found a dead insect (I am not kidding). The staff is very unlikeable, you tell them what does not work and they pretend they don't understand you (I can speak English, French and Spanish too). Anyway there is no problem for them, because you must pay in advance. The location: near the station. The area is not dangerous thanks to the police, but it is not interesting either, at least for me. In the future I will carefully choose an hotel in a different area.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam6680
Reviews.Content: The room i had room 102 was very hard to locate on arrival, as the hotel is a maze of corridors up and down stairs, very poor room number signage. when i entered the room i was met with two single beds so close together you have to walk sideways to get to the TV and table and chairs, the TV was the only good thing in the room, and worth more than the fittings all put together.
