The wall above one bed was unpainted in places, and had two or three bare wires sticking out of the wall.. i guess lights would be fitted one day, there was other bare patches of plaster waiting a coat of paint. not nice, The toilet had a strong smell of staleness.. i use my words carefully. The toilet seat was not attached to the pan. The carpet and bedding where not too clean. The room had a window in the far corner, it was boarded up 3 quarters of the way up, and my 'view was a 2 foot square looking upwards at another window next door.. crap. If you want to stay here, DO NOT get Rm 102... or any low numbers, as i guess they will all be uninhabitable like my one.. I for one would not stay here again, the ONLY plus point is how close it is to the station and Damrak, also the Dam Square area. The red light area is very close. but on the other hand so is a church with Bells from Hell.. all in all... You get what you pay for... in this case 180 euro for two nights in a garden shed.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant hotel but great location!!”
Reviews.Author: bressybutt
Reviews.Content: Firstly I'd like to say that i usually stay in chain hotels such as Holiday Inn Express, Holiday Inn, Sheraton, Travelodge, Britannia Hotels, Ibis Hotel, Best Western and a few others. Usually my budget for a hotel room is approximately GBP80 (depending on the location). Anyway, this is the first time i stayed in a non-chain hotel. I paid approx GBP65/night which is a very good price for a 3-star hotel in Amsterdam as most hotels charge over GBP100/night. The location is very good, its approx 5~10mins walk from the Amsterdam Central Station (Train) and right next to the Red Light District. The hotel generally looked very old, nothing like the photos on the official website. Either they Photoshop the photos alot (which most hotels do anyway) or they haven't updated the photos for like 10yrs. Looking at the hotel room photos what other users submitted, it looked alright and looked a bit better than Travelodge. However i think the hotel rooms are very inconsistent. I stayed in room 320, the room was worn out, very old and very stuffy. No air-conditioner, the windows were not double glazed, the shower curtain is not working well and no tea/coffee facilities. The toilet was disgusting and designed very weirdly. Thats not the worst, when me and my girlfriend came back, had a shower and went to bed. It was very hard to sleep as it was very stuffy and then after a while we both start to itch. After 1hr or so, we realised there are bit marks (similar to a mosquito bite) on our arms. It is most likely from BED BUGS or FLEAS. We went down to the concierge and showed him the bite marks, he was very nice and changed the room for us. We moved to room 25 (at the ground floor) which was a A LOT BETTER - there was tea/coffee facilities, air-conditioner,. much nicer walls/decor compared to room 320. To avoid any chances of bed bugs or flea bites, we asked for the antiseptic spray and sprayed the bed just in case as a precaution. Finally a good sleep and definitely worth the GBP65/night i paid. What i suggest is perhaps pay an extra GBP10/night or so for a better/cleaner and decent room. There is definitely a huge inconsistency of the rooms. My girlfriend is generally quite sensitive with fleas/bed-bugs and i myself would say i generally dont attract fleas/bed-bugs. Some say its because of the blood type but whatever it is, it must be very bad. Anyway, i would stay in the hotel again and would recommend it to others if its room 26 but i will NEVER stay in room 320 as it seemed i got the worst hotel room in the hotel. Just don't expect the hotel to be modern decor or with many facilities Tea and coffee facilities is extremely important in Amsterdam because there are no proper supermarkets and a large bottled water cost EUR3 and a large bottled coke cost EUR4. The left luggage room was very poor because the staff just hands you the key to the room and you put your own luggage in yourself. I dont think they'd know if you took one more bag with you away. There was no tag or anything to ID your back. Most hotels usually have a tag or at least have a staff with you to the room. Therefore i would recommend you keep your passports and money with you if you want to leave luggage in the hotel rather than taking the luggage with you all around town. Overall, I reckon the bad reviews were from users who probably stayed in room 320 or similar and the good reviews are from users that stayed in rooms like room 25. The location is definitely very good if your planning to visit sex shops and the Red Light District. I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights on 25th and 26th August 2009.

Reviews.Title: “clean, cozy, convenient.”
Reviews.Author: bdbdbd74
Reviews.Content: Ordinarily accustomed to stay in much more upscale hotels, but Hotel Terminus was on par with what we were looking for: inexpensive, close, and clean. The rooms are very cozy and restful, the breakfast was quite good, and the staff was very kind and helpful. I will say it's proximity to Oude Kerk and it's every-15-minute bell-pealing can be quite beutiful at one moment, then slightly irritating the next -- doesn't make for a mid-afternoon nap very well. But you will certainly learn the chimes for each quarter... :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location-Rubbish Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: sydneybloggs
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Amsterdam at 10am, we caught the train from Schiphol into Amsterdam (this is a really cheap and easy way to get into Amsterdam center). We eventually found the 'hotel' and asked reception if we could have our room slightly before 3pm as we had no where to go, they told us this was not possible. They said we could leave our bag's in a locked room, I was a bit worried about doing this as I had read a review on here saying that this room was not safe but it was 11am and we had 4hrs to kill before we could get into our room. I kept all my valubles in my hand bag just incase, but I did feel abit worried walking around Amsterdam with everything on me. When we finally got into our room, we were very disapointed. It was tiny, no view out of the window exept the hotel corridor. We had to go up 2 steps into the little bathroom, my partner is 6'3'' and hit his head quite a few times. The ''breakfast'' is auful, if your not down there early enough all your left with is toast. I found the staff quite rude. The noise is shocking! Not from the church bells but the hotel. The head board of our bed was against a wall that was a staircase, you could here people ALL the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Very poor service, maybe messing with us?”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelors
Reviews.Content: So, my husband and I had just gotten married and after a LONG three-week stay in France for our wedding (He and his family are French, I am American), we were looking forward to going to Amsterdam for a few days to unwind with a couple of our friends. We searched long and hard for a hotel in Amsterdam that was affordable, was centrally located, & looked clean and nice. And we thought we found that with the Hotel Terminus! When we made the arrangements at the Hotel, we mentioned that it was our little, brief, honeymoon, and if they could accommodate us, that would be wonderful. When we arrived with our two friends, they promptly put us in the most terrible and disgusting room I have EVER stayed in in a hotel and put our two friends in a gorgeous room. After I had nicely mentioned again while checking in that it was our honeymoon. (Now, as a side note, I really have to say that my husband and I travel A LOT. We do not usually have very high expectations for where we stay, and are usually very pleasantly surprised both by accommodations and service. We are both very nice and polite and understand that there are very different cultural traditions and customs everywhere you go, so we try to be kind, understanding, reasonable people!!!) So, after we got to the room, which was very difficult with all our bags from the wedding (because the Terminus must me named for it's interminable staircases and strange, Stanley Kubrick-esque hallways!) my dear husband went back to the front desk to explain that the dirty, stained 1970's porno-nightmare we were staying in was not really the modern, nice hotel room we had seen in the pictures and had expected. So the girl, with a little smirk on her face, apparently, said no problem and immediately moved us to another room (Obvs, they didn't offer to help with our many bags). So my husband thanked her, took the new key, and came back to the old room to get the bags and me. After shuffling down the long, long staircase with our ridiculous bags (we don't normally travel that way - remember this was just after our huge wedding and we had a ton of stuff for that!!!) and got in the questionable elevator that was, thankfully, working just fine. As we were getting in, some poor guy that worked at the hotel was getting off, and my husband asked him to help us with the rest of the move. To which he graciously agreed (per what I assume is actually his job description.) So, and I am not kidding, we went down a floor, walked down a long, hallway, down some stairs, through another hallway, up some more stairs, around several corners and another hallway until we found the other room at the end. And THAT room WAS the exact room we had seen advertised online. So, it is there, and it was very, very nice. However, please also note that the Terminuns is VERY close to the Belfoi, so if you want to sleep past 8 in the morning (which might have been nice for us on our honeymoon, exhausted as we were after the trip!) DO NOT stay at this place, either. The bells are VERY loud, unpredictable (didn't follow any kind of pattern time-wise we could decipher) and went off at all hours of the day. Some staff was very nice, but I think the woman who checked up in must have been messing with us. We are always really polite, but I think she just made an assumption about us based on our luggage and nationalities. We looked a little bedraggled when we came in, too. But I would have to say, if you are trying to have a nice, easy stay, I would not recommend the Terminus. The location IS amazing and very hard to beat, but the hotel staff, other than the poor guy who bore the brunt of his colleague's little trick on us after moving several of our bags down the hall, is questionable. And the other man who worked as a concierge was very nice, but extremely understaffed with a huge line of people waiting to check in the next day. Maybe not very effective at his job. And our wake-up call for 6:30 am on our last morning (in order to make our 7:45 shuttle) was, for some reason, maybe by accident, maybe not, scheduled for 7:30. After being really clear about it. Anyway, our trip was great, and the room they moved us to was like a different world compared to the first, so all's well that ends well. They just didn't know when they were messing with us that I like to blast the internet with reviews! Maybe they'll be more careful next time!!!

Reviews.Title: “No internet as advertised but no refund”
Reviews.Author: mikemercuur
Reviews.Content: Jan 20 2009 I booked for a stay Jan 26-Feb 01 2009 via bookings[--] Upon arrival around 6-7pm I was told there was no internet for a while, maybe at the end of the week but she was not sure about that and I had to pay the first day anyway as per cancelation conditions of bookings[--]. I told the desk clerk that they did not meet their part of the deal and asked if I could store my stuff in the room while going to look for another hotel After 30min I came back to pick up my luggage and was made to understand I had to pay.... To prevent any problem with police etc I signed the credit card slip and told the clerk I was going to request a full refund since they did not meet their part of the deal Various mails were sent to bookings[--] and the hotel and all I was offered is partial refund which I principally refuse. I cannot recommend such a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Balou1999
Reviews.Content: Hotel Terminus is at the entrance to the Red Light District behind the Beurs van Berlage. The hotel has a secure luggage room available for storage. Their is also an elevator but their still might be stairs to climb when you get to your floor. The breakfast, which was included in my rate, was decent. Mostly cold items, served in a trendy room on the ground floor behind the elevator. The bells that everyone harped on were not that bad. The only time I heard them is when I popped in during day for a short rest. If you are a light sleeper or late riser you might want to get some earplugs. I did however have a problem with the crew cleaning the street and deliveries to the surrounding business to be a little annoying. All in all it was a decent stay and would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Some advice before you book....”
Reviews.Author: philbill
Reviews.Content: We just got back from two nights here. The price (99 Euros a night including breakfast) was very cheap for Amsterdam, so if price and a central location are important then go ahead. The overall rating is based on this. Earplugs are provided which gives you an idea of the street noise and the church bells. We were given an attic room with sloping ceilings where only one person could move at a time (it was so small). The outlets were hanging out leaving gaping holes in the walls The LOUD fan in the bathroom could not be turned off, and there was mold on the ceiling. I went down and very nicely asked for another room. We waited one and a half hours and got a very adequate larger room. The linens were very clean and there were two chairs (okay so one was broken) and a small table, desk and flat screen TV. Breakfast was very good with cooked food as well as a large variety of cheese, cold cuts, cereal, croissants etc. etc.. The desk staff were very helpful. They did say that they had business rooms available (very large with a/c and a small sofa etc.) for 130 Euros. All in all Amsterdam is not that great of a city (teeming with people and the same construction all over as two years' ago when we visited!), and you would be advised to get the train to one of the smaller towns and stay there. I must say that we were spoiled because of the much lower rates in other European cities (and we stayed at Hilton Hotels). At the weekend there were dubious looking types staying there, but on the Monday we saw many businessmen checking in. It is on the edge of the red light district. Oh..Kopke is a great restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “the mice were friendly........”
Reviews.Author: JKLGlasgow
Reviews.Content: just back from a 2 night break at this hotel. Have to agree with majority of the other reviews that the location is perfect - everything within walking distance. The hotel is in need of refurbishment. Our room (18) was in one of the lower levels and spacious enough for two, however carpet was very dirty and room a bit smelly. Had the unfortunate event of running into a mouse in the corridoor and watched it scurry off into the breakfast room - hence why I skipped the breakfast on our last morning... Basically an okay hotel for a lads weekend where location is important and your not looking for any kind of luxury... otherwise stay clear and dont go leaving cheese lying about your room ;)

Reviews.Title: “An OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrcool76
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here, must say it is in a great location can't fault with that. Annoying thing was you can be awaken by the church bell in the morning. (However they do supply you with ear plugs). I would come back to this hotel again only for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “As expected if not better for an Amsterdam hotel near red light.”
Reviews.Author: MFM14
Reviews.Content: This hotel did the trick. We booked a buisness room which, from the reviews I've read here, is the way to go. Our room was clean and actually spacious for a European hotel room. The street noise didn't seem to bother us (the provided ear plugs might have helped). The near by church bells actually didn't seem to be a problem either. The hotel's location is what makes it appealing. It is a 3 minute walk from Amsterdam Centraal station. We had a satisfactory stay here and wouldn't hesistate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay In This Hotel If You Would Like To Be Robbed”
Reviews.Author: rachaelm0
Reviews.Content: Some girlfriends and I stayed in the hotel for a long three-night stay. The location cannot be faulted, being down a side street off one of the main areas near the red light district. However be prepared to be woken up from approximately 7am with church bells every 30 minutes and traffic straight outside your window. I booked three triple rooms about 6 months ago. When we arrived, the receptionist informed me that one of the rooms had been changed to a quadruple room and they were 'fully booked', but "don't worry, this is an upgrade". The quadruple room was located in the basement. It had one small window, was dark and dingy and not too dissimilar to that of a dormitory. It did, in fact, have 6 beds, no mirror and no safe. I complained at reception, to be told that they usually gave this room to groups of lads. The receptionist then informed me that she had in fact just sold the last room, so earlier when we arrived they were in fact not fully booked. Eventually they upgraded our room to a business room, which are very nice, has a free safe, a hairdryer in the bathroom, nice toiletries, towels, a TV and a fridge in the room. On the day of departure, we left our bags in the luggage room, as our flight wasn't until the evening. The door to the luggage room had a key card lock on it and was straight opposite reception. On return, approximately 6 hours later, the receptionist (whom I believe was the Manager), was very blasÃ© in informing us that our bags had been gone through by a thief. She then went on to tell us that if we so wished to make a complaint, the Police Station was down the road, which was no use to us as we had a plane to catch. Our items of clothing were scattered all over the luggage room. Luckily, we had taken everything valuable out with us, so nothing had been taken. I would not stay here again due to the extremely poor hotel manner and customer service. If you stay here, make absolute certain that you book a business room at the rear of the hotel and don't leave your bags in the luggage room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, reasonable price, Spartan room”
Reviews.Author: Lulya
Reviews.Content: October 10-12, 2008 Excellent location, in the center of everythihg, but off city noise. Reasonable price for Amsterdam. Sufficient breakfast - you can eat it. Room tiny and furnished in Spartan mode. Fore two adults it was not simple to move. Bathroom was very old, but clean. Staff is heplful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Just A Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelk9
Reviews.Content: Don't look for anything grand about this hotel. It is just a simple place to stay. The place was clean and comfortable. As with all buildings in Amsterdam, the original builders maximaize every millimeter of space. The stairs are narrow but this is part of the architecture of all buildings. Rooms do have room to move about and the restroom was clean. If you want normal american size and amenities then this not a place for you. If want a place to sleep and get clean, and don't mind to give and experence the way of life in Amsterdam then this is the place for you. The staff was very nice and helpful. They gave good reccomendations on places to go and maps of Amsterdam. The hotel is very close to the red light district, short walk to Anne Frank's house, and a short walk to the train station. Oh, as for the bell. I can not remember hearing the bell, but then again memories are hazy about coming in for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Just as expected!”
Reviews.Author: workshy07
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews seem fair - it's not a luxury hotel by any means, but you wouldn't be expecting that surely considering the price. (prices seem generally high for hotels here, or am I rubbish at bargain hunting?) Our room smelt a little musty, but was a good size and had large windows which you could open wide to get fresh air (wouldn't want to have a child in the room, as could fall out of the window easily). Location fantastic IF you are not averse to sex shops, prostitues, drug taking nearby or extreme drunkeness. If you are, then stay in some other part of Amsterdam. There are so many beautiful areas. I am not really fussed by any of those things, so location suited me and my husband just fine! Nothing alse significant to note about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location / location”
Reviews.Author: siberianpack
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Three females for a 40th birthday. Had reservations after reading reviews. The location was excellent, beside the Grasshopper.. Only heard the 'Bells' on an afternoon nap after a late night. Room was very large, with large windows overlooking side street. Very clean and suited requirements for two days. Breakfast was extra â‚¬12.50 all you can eat, not bad. Hotel was very quiet, in fact only saw a flow of people at breakfast time. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: PaulMUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for two nights July 18th -20th 2008. As other reviewers have noted, we were charged an extra 25 Euros on checkout for breakfast even though it was included in our booking. I was in a part yof 20 and ours was the only room that was charged this. All rooms were booked at the same time.If hotel staff read these reviews, can I have my money back ? Our double room (320) was fairly small, two single beds pushed up against each other. Bathroom large and clean but shower inefficient to the point of being virtually useless. Shower curtain rail bowing in the middle and held together with black tape. This hotel is in an excellent central location, very close to Dam Square, the Red light district and the railway station. Downsid e to this of course, as with any city centre hotel, is noise, particularly the bells as others have noted. On the plus side, my companions and I managed to drink so much that this was never a problem for us. Breakfast excellent, but breakfast room extremely hot, to the point of being uncomfortable. If i get some money back from them I would use this place again. Otherwise, no.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: rpt1968
Reviews.Content: had a god stay here which although is not over plush is respectable. great location near grasshoppers red light district and dam sq. rooms functional we had no bath though, but lots of room. staff ok, but june the recpt/barman was great fun and looked after us, worth going to meet him! hotel bit to pricey but clean and recommend

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: JimiHalifax
Reviews.Content: Had an extremely good experience at Hotel terminus. Booked triple room (one queen one single bed). Great size room 219 with large double window and a table and three chairs, overlooking the courtyard. Had no problem with the bells we rather enjoyed them (maybe the smoke in the air?). No face cloths. Narrow spiral staircase (pretty cool). Couldn't hear the neighbours. Location, location, location, 50 feet from redlight district. 10 min walk to centraal stn. Good staff quite helpful. If you are there to enjoy red light and cafes I didn't see a better place. Electronic room keys. Will definitely be staying at Terminus on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge room, clean, great for price”
Reviews.Author: europe_tcandlj_08
Reviews.Content: We seem to have a totally different experience to the last review! Greeted by a helpful staff member, no problems checking in. Room was huge with high ceilings! I think the largest room I have ever had in Europe. Clean and tidy and really nice bathroom. Location was perfect, no noise and no bells that I could here. Lift worked great and I found the stairs large... Only issue, room did smell a little smokey...but for the price and location it was a perfect hotel for our 2 night visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Terminus...More like Hotel Terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: Sugarsweet2000ie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Terminus...More like Hotel Terrible!! Myself and my boyfriend arrived at reception and we were greeted by one of the rudest people I have ever met! We handed over our print out from the booking agent and the receptionist informed me that we would not be getting breakfast - I stated that breakfast was indeed included in my price, he told me it wasn't and therefore didn't bother to tell me where the breakfast room was.. Went up to our room and it was smelly, small and grubby! Certainly wouldn't have classed it as a 3 star hotel.. I don't know who wrote in a previous review that they never heard bells ring - the bells rang EVERY bloomin' other hour and sleep was something that was difficult to get! Yes - I would agree that Hotel Terrible is in a good location - minutes away from everything... However if you want a good nights sleep in order to enjoy the sights and scenary - well then this hotel is NOT for you! After a day - the lift broke!! And we spent the next two days walking up and down 3 flights of narrow stairs...Nightmare when carrying suitcases... Finally came to checking out - this was indeed another experience... I was informed that they charged a 'City Tax' on top of the price that I had already paid. So I had to hand over extra money that I was unaware about...THIS IS THE BEST PART - The receptionist then tells me that they "charge a â‚¬1.00 administration fee".... So I need to pay â‚¬1.00 for her to print out my bill.... How ridiculous... I know it is only a euro - but it's the fact that they add these ridiculous fees! So the best part of my hotel experience was pushing the doors open and leaving with my suitcase! I couldn't wait to get back on the plane, get home and have a decent shower.... But again... like I say - if you tend to be up all night partying and don't need much sleep - you'll hardly notice the annoyances that I had...

Reviews.Title: “Clean but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: cdg04
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Terminus. It was a nice room however it was quite noisy. The church bells rang quite often during the night (every 7 minutes or so) and it was otherwise quite noisy as the voices from the street easily penetrated the windows. All the amenities were quite nice and the hotel does have Wi-fi (although you do have to pay 12 Euros to use it for the day). Conveniently located about 5 minutes from Centraal station and just around the corner from the red light district. An oddity I found with the room (and this may be quite common in Europe) was that the bed was made up with a fitted sheet and a bedspread that covered the top of the bed (and didn't go down the sides. This meant that when there were 2 of you in bed that you had to sleep quite close to each other otherwise you wouldn't be covered by the bedspread...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Clean”
Reviews.Author: NickkiNewark8
Reviews.Content: Hotel Terminus - Amsterdan April, 2008 Trip Advisor Member - Phoenix, Arizona Stayed at the Hotel Terminus and it has a great location and is a clean hotel (bring washcloths they do not have them). We took the train from the airport - about 20 minutes and you get off at Centraal Station which is a 10 minute walk from the Terminus (an easy walk). The breakfast is very nice and not only coldcuts they have scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage along with fruit, ceral and assorted pastries. We had several tours booked with Lindburgh Tours and the tour office where the buses leave from was a 3 minute walk from the Terminus (Damrik St. I think) and it was so easy to get to. The hotel is one block from the famous "Red Light District" so it was easy to walk through. The only drawback to the hotel was the checkin time. We arrived at 9AM and could not checkin until 3PM but they did have a luggage room to store bags. The hotel was full so maybe if it's not they will let you checkin early does not hurt to ask. Nice clean bathroom with tub and shower and plenty of hot water. Would recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Tesq
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Terminus was right in the heart of the action in Amsterdam, just a hop, skip, and a jump to the Red Light District, and the coffeshops. Our group had 3 rooms, they were all clean, no problems. I read so many reviews before we went that said the church bells were loud and bothersome--none of us ever heard the bells, and I am a very light sleeper. It was, however, somewhat noisy due to the volume of people walking along the square below our room, at all hours. The rest of our party had rooms that did not face the square, so they were quieter. The hotel definitely has very weird stairs, long and winding, many narrow--that was the only negative, as once we got off the elevator there was still a long walk to our room up these stairs. The 6 of us are all in our late 20s/early 30s and we would happily return to the Hotel Terminus. I wouldn't stay there with kids, too close to the fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to stumble back to!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovelotsofholidays
Reviews.Content: I have been to Amsteradm 4 times and this hotel was the by far the best location and value for money over the others I have stayed in. It is only a 5 minute walk from central station which is very handy when its chucking it down with rain as it often does in Amsterdam!! We booked a business room which was very large for amsterdam standards. This included an in room safe, minibar and even BBC1 and 2 on the TV although we didnt stay in to watch TV. Bathroom was brand new and the room was very clean. I found the reception staff to be very helpful and polite. No problem if you need to leave your luggage either, Would stay here again if I come back to Amsterdam, overall very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “good location it's all u get”
Reviews.Author: TOKYONIGHTS
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in this hotel you should know that they have a late check in at 15:00 which may be inconvienient if you arrive early in the morning. The girls at the reception desk are not very polite and if you have any problem you should talk to one of the guys. This hotel is definetly not a 3 star but more like a 2star, because the rooms doesn't have anything special.

Reviews.Title: “I Amsterdam-Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: stelioskaterina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near all the main attractions of Amsterdam and the Central Station. We have booked 6 double rooms. All of them were very spacious and cleaning was satisfactory. One of our rooms was on the 1st floor, facing the street of the back side of the hotel. As a result it was noisy throughout the day and sometimes even dangerous from passers- by, being drunk. Breakfast was very good and the staff was most of them helpful and friendly. In conclusion Terminus is a good choice, specially in terms of value for money. I will be visiting Amsterdam again, it was a great experience.... with no kids and definitely no KLM the worse airline company. stelios-Katerina Greece

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: ignacio_ana
Reviews.Content: Great location, near central station, red light distric and Dam Square. It's clean, the staff was very helpfull and the breakfast was adequate. The price is very reasonable for Amsterdam. A bit noisy during weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: blaghaus
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at more expensive hotels, and being a bit of a hotel snob, I booked two nights at the terminus with some trepidation. However, my fears were unfounded. The hotel was clean, the staff were very helpful, and the location was fantastic. 10 minute walk from Centraal Station, and a stones throw from the red light district with its bars, the location couldn't be better. Whilst its certainly not the best hotel I've stayed in in Amsterdam, its quality for the price cannot be argued against. Ideal for young couples and singles, I highly recommend the Hotel Terminus.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Central Station and Red Light District, best looking hotel in area”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany_UTA
Reviews.Content: Our trip: Amsterdam was the 2nd stop on our 1st trip to Europe. We booked through europeandestinations.com for 8 nights, air and train for 2 for $2800. We arrived from Paris on the Thalys train to Central Station. Of course, it was typical Amsterdam and drizzling when we arrived. We started to take a taxi to the hotel, but the taxi host told us, you can see the hotel from the station, which is true. If you walk south from the station, turn left at the end of the canal and it's the 1st street on the right. Our room: Check in was nice and easy. They all spoke great English, all over Amsterdam. Our first room was on the '2nd floor'. Just so you know, there are 4 stairs to get to the elevator, once we got to the 2nd floor, there was another set of 4 stairs and a 15 stair staircase to get to our room. It was tough to lug the bags up there. Our friends were on the 1st floor and only had the 1 set of 4 stairs, so if that's an issue for you, ask for the lower floors. Day 1 was great, nice bed, view of the church tower and a nice bathroom. We came back after lunch and there was a horrible smell of urine! We called the front desk and were immediately switched to a quad room in a basement type floor, much better. We had 2 singles separate and 2 twins together. Bathroom was the same as before. Plenty of counter room, hair dryer etc. Note: All rooms smell like smoke, even the non smoking ones, I can only wonder how bad the smoking ones smell. But then again it's Amsterdam, everyone is 'smoking' everywhere. Also, the staircases are more like ladders. They are so steep. Red Light District and Coffeeshops: If you walk 2 streets over after making a right at the end of the street Beurstraat, there you are in the top of the red light district, it goes on for blocks and on all the neighboring side streets. It was even packed just walking around when it was raining. It was a strange sight to see. The coffeeshops are EVERYWHERE, the only difference between them is the type of seating and music. They do have great coffee! Food: We liked the Marco Polo pizza on the main street near Central Station. Also, there is a nice jazz bar/restaurant called Old Quarter pub. Day trip: We bought $10 tickets and took a train ride to Muiden where they have a castle from 1280. Was the best part of the trip. Anne Frank house is good too. It was raining, so we took a cab from the hotel, it was $12 and we walked back, just a few blocks. Please let me know if you have any questions. Would I stay here again? It felt a little dingy, but I probably would because the other hotels in the area looked a lot worse! If you want to be in this area, it's an ok place to be. Nothing fancy. It did feel very safe to me. There's a police station down the street!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but an Adventure in Amaterdam”
Reviews.Author: agentclear
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 406 (single) the very top room in the hotel - the heat didn't reach up there (I went in December - 20 degees F outside) so the staff brought up an electric heater which did the job. The room was small and shower was triangular (had to stand in one position to get showered). I should have splurged for one of their larger double rooms. But all in all, It was a great hotel. Friendly staff and great location - 3 blocks from RLD.

Reviews.Title: “Never again....”
Reviews.Author: GLENCO
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Swissotel (Damrak) for two nights on several previous weekend stays in Amsterdam with my girlfriend, we decided to stay 3 nights this time for the same cost. Therefore, we shopped about and following the reviews on the usually highly trustworthy Tripadvisor...we booked into the Terminus through Expedia. The location was fine as it was central as we needed. However, the first room we were given was street level opposite the Stones Cafe...if my other half had stood in the window with the lights on she'd have had offers for sex such was the poor privacy it offered. The lighting was woeful, the 3 single beds were dirty and the room reminded me of a stag weekend special rate offer! We complained .To the hotels' credit, they moved us to the 2nd floor and a real double as we had booked. However, it was still a real drop down in class from the Swissotel...yes, I know you get what you pay for...but the difference of Â£20 per night would have been worth every penny. This hotel is worn out, creaking, out of date and ideal for drunk stag parties who won't be able to see the detail due to them being stoned or drunk!!!! If you are a couple looking for something a little better....do your self a favour....look up the road at the hotel with a swiss sounding name!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BlogGrandVoyageur
Reviews.Content: Very central location close to Central Station and Dam Square. The room was much bigger than expected and very clean. The breakfast buffet offered bacon and eggs in addition to the standard toast and jam in a very nice looking dining area.The only drawback was the street noise facing the back side of the hotel late at night with a lot of pubs and the red light district on that side. Would recommend a front facing room for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates, good service & location”
Reviews.Author: BigJimCardiff
Reviews.Content: Hotel Terminus is situated very near the train station, just before you reah the RLD. I have stayed here near on 10 times now, and stayed in several different rooms! The rooms are averaged sized, with all expected amenities (Shower, Toilet, TV, etc). Some have air conditioning, but those that don't, do have openable windows! All the staff at this hotel are very helpful and help make your stay pleasant. The price for rooms are very reasonable and within most peoples budgets! I would definitely recommend this place to my friends, family and anyone who ask for a hotel of this type.

Reviews.Title: “Five star quality”
Reviews.Author: shazel
Reviews.Content: As I was travelling with friends and we were in amsterdam for the same reason as every other group of young adults...to see the famous red light district and venture into a "smoking friendly cafe" location of our hotel was extremely important..The terminus hotel is located right on the edge of the red light district in amesterdam, its location is excellent! Not in the red light district so you are away from the scummy people at night.. There is a phone and internet cafe 2 doors down, so it makes it very conveinant to keep in touch with family and friends, the grass hopper restaurant is at the end of the street and the food is superb! The foyer of this hotel is very modern and stylish, front desk are very helpful and friendly! The down side to this hotel is to get to our room we had to go up and down several flights of stairs once we had gotten to our floor! it sounds odd but it was like a maze!! Our room was very modern and cosy, the bathroom was well fitted out and the shower was large and clean. The television had a good choice of channels, including several english movie channels and news channels! Breakfast was amazing, there was a large spread of hot and cold dishes which were all yum!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Centrally Located and Decent Price!”
Reviews.Author: Helen_and_Rich
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Hotel Terminus on 18th July 2007. We had read the reviews on this site and at first were a little apprehensive about the 'bells' from the church opposite waking us up. We ended up in a room opposite the church and did not hear them once during the night! This hotel is really close to everything. At the end of the street is where the canal boat tours start (highly recommended) and just around the corner from the red light district. We felt totally safe at the hotel and were not put off at all by the red light district. The staff were friendly and polite. We were put in room 104 which I could definately recommend. The room was spacious and clean with a decent sized bathroom. We had a sitting area in the room which we were pretty pleased with! Whilst the bells didn't bother us we did hear a few rowdy groups late at night but it was over with pretty quickly and it wasn't something I would complain about. Breakfast was pretty typical European fare and very tasty! Check out the Chandeliers in the breakfast room (If my house was big enough I'd fancy one in my living room!) I'd recommend this for most types of people, the stairs are pretty tight (as with most places in Holland!) but there is a lift for people with problems with stairs.

Reviews.Title: “brill hotel...”
Reviews.Author: dreder
Reviews.Content: top location,,,great price, 3 rd time i,ve stopped here....and many more to come i hope..happy damming...

Reviews.Title: “Too much noise!”
Reviews.Author: Mariako
Reviews.Content: Excellent location close to the central train station. Near the red light district. On the other side of the street was a pub and the noise in night was terrible! Friendly staff. Excellent breakfast and service. Ask to have room upstairs and in the front side of the building!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Upstairs.. It's worth the hike!”
Reviews.Author: OhioTrvlnMan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient to the train station. IF you know where you are going. I was greeted by a delightful bloke who was quite informative with regard to the surrounding area. By the way, the hotel charges 12 Euro/24 hrs for wi-fi internet service yet there is an internet site 4 doors away and the fee was 1.50 Euro per hour. AVOID Room 20. This is a ground level room with sealed windows. Although air conditioned, this did not help the mold and mildew growing on the walls which made the room musty. They did not have an available room for me to which therefore I could not move until the second night. I appreciated the fact that when I returned to the hotel late at night. I had to be rung in by the employee staffing the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: CaptainsWife1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Terminus over the Easter weekend and the hotel and location was very good. Yes, you are close to the red light district, but just turn left out of the hotel instead of right and you will miss it all. We had booked a superior room through a website and that worked out really well. However I knew beforehand and it can be a problem but there is a cultural centre right opposite the hotel were the bells/carillion go every quarter of an hour. The hotel do supply ear plugs so they recognise the problem and I do urge you to wear them as it can be a problem., especially if the weather was very hot and you need to open windows. Don't miss the Anne Frank house or the Van Gogh Museum, but do get there before opening as the queues build up really quickly and can take forever to get in. Also use the trams to get around as they are really efficient and cheap 1.60 euros per person and that takes you to lots of different areas within the city. Whatever you do take a look at the red light district if only for a laugh. Oh and don't be afraid of the so-called "coffee" shops that are really selling drugs. They are easily recognisable so you won't make an accidental mistake. ENJOY !

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: becki1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located to all of amsterdam's tourist attractions, including the red light district, coffee shops and most major museums. The service is above average with daily maid service and changing of towels etc. Unsuitable for families with children, in my opinion, due to the hotel being adjacent to the red light district. Staff are very friendly and helpful. the only reason I have not given this hotel an excellent rating is because of the noise of the bells, while it is not overwhelmingly loud they can be heard early in the morning. Would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again if and when I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, too close to the red light district if taking childen”
Reviews.Author: trafficboy
Reviews.Content: Grat location, but too close to redlight district if taking childen. Few mins walk from central station and dam square

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: twiggy-and-gin
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I recently stayed in a triple room in the Hotel Terminus and had a great time. It is literally a five-minute walk from Central Station, although we got lost on the way because the size of the streets on the maps can be deceiving compared to reality! Beware - the streets really are tiny!!! The staff in the hotel were very friendly and always willing to give advice to where to go, what to do and how to do it. They were very helpful at times. The room however was quite small for three people. It is simply a double room with an extra bed squeezed in, but it was everything we needed for our stay so we were happy enough. Lovely bathroom too. The location of the hotel is probably it's best factor. It is located on a very quiet street but 10 seconds away, around the corner you encounter an endless amount of shops, bars, coffeeshops and a really buzzing atmosphere. It's great! Dam Square and great shopping is literally 5 minutes away, if even. The Hotel is also right beside a police station as well so security is very good. I was worried about the bells when I read previous reviews but we really didn't take any notice of them. The tune they play is almost theraputic (when you do hear it) and after all, if you don't want to hear traditional church bells then maybe you have planned a trip to the wrong city!! Overall the hotel is a great place to stay if you want somewhere that is centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Those bells!!”
Reviews.Author: denzjane
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just right for Centraal Station, the shops and the red light district. Unfortunately it is also very close to those bells!! Our room was very warm, wonderful for September, not so good for us, as there was no air conditioning and to have the windows open meant hearing the constant ringing. Not the best two nights sleep we've ever had! Room was clean although small but okay for a short stay. We would consider the Terminus again, especially if we could resolve the air con & noise problem.

Reviews.Title: “The Bells, The Bells”
Reviews.Author: brinker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November. The Triple Room was the best that we encountered in our 11 trips to Amsterdam. Honestly, the room is absolutley fine, although there is no safe. The staff were friendly, much friendlier than your average Dutchman in the service industry, and it was clean. However, this is all completely offset by the bells. Even with ear plugs sleeping after 6am was almost impossible, they go off every 15 minutes and believe me, they are loud and will wake you up. Do not kid yourself that an ensemble of church bells less than 70 metres away will be tolerable. All in, even though the hotels facilities, room standard and location are more than good, it's all ruined by the bells.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convienient”
Reviews.Author: Windsock
Reviews.Content: Booked the Terminus for its location, and wasn't let down. Only a few 100 yards from Central station, and on a quieter street just away from the Red light area. We had been considering getting a cab from the station with my elder dad and the suitcases, but it was very much easier and quicker to walk. The front of the hotel opens on to a completly normal street, with Dam Sqare, and the main shopping streets not far away, and the main redlight area with its cafes just round the corner but not obtrusive. It was very handy for the Beurse Belage which was hosting a good (Bokbier) festival at the time. We wern't expecting much from a 3 star this near to the station but the hotel exceeded our expectations. We had a room at the front on only the first floor, but apart from the occasional noisy passer by, there were no reportable disturbances. The room size was adequate, although one of the smaller rooms according to the fire plan. Hotel service was good, and they satisfied our requests for a double and single close to each other. Good safe in the wardrobe. Breakfast was good, but quite expensive. Security was good with key cards, and automatically with one per person. Would definatly consider for my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good points and bad points”
Reviews.Author: dackman
Reviews.Content: Bit of a mixed one this. The hotel was in a great location and the rooms were clean and bathrooms excellent. They allowed storage of luggage before and after check-in and -out. The staff were for the most part very good. That's the good points - here are the bad... the rooms were strange - our's had a low sloping ceiling which meant I had to walk with a stoop if I didn't want to smack my head on it. My friends room had a dangerously steep staircase/ladder up to a second level where the bed was. The (none-smoking) room stunk of cigarette smoke, as did the corridors, although they also smelled of urine. The room was wrong - we were given a twin instead of a double. They changed the room and the man on the desk sent us the wrong way to get to the new one and then when we came back lost refused to take us to the other room and was extremely rude to us. When we found the new room it was still a twin but with the beds pushed together. Beware the location too - near the station means near the great big clock (opposite) which chimes every 15 minutes and can keep you awake. Also, if you're on the ground floor, forget about sleeping as the traffic and people outside are noisy at all hours. All in all, I wouldn't return. Very, very overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Keggor
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the hotel terminus for 4 nights. I was'nt expecting anything great from the hotel because it was so cheap but I was very surprised. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We stayed in a double room which was big,clean and very comfortable. There was 1 double bed, a single bed, a television and an en-suite bathroom with a shower/bath. The hotel was very central and we were only a 5 min walk from Dam square.The only bad thing about the hotel was the noise from the church bells(which we got used to after a while) and our noisy neighbours but at least they got us up in the mornings. I would highly recommend this hotel because compared to other Amsterdam hotels it's paradise.

Reviews.Title: “good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: mogsy2
Reviews.Content: hotel is ideally suited to all main parts of Amsterdam and is also excellent value for money , staff are helpful and friendly and hotel is suitable for small groups and couples alike. Only downside would be the church bells that seem to go on all morning but at least it gets you out of bed from the night before. All in all would definetely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable stay, unusual room”
Reviews.Author: Auston
Reviews.Content: Location-wise, the Terminus is perfectâ€¦just a short walk from the Central Station, Dam Square and â€œallâ€� thatâ€™s around the area. Not the most up-to-date place, but it served me well during my stay. Nice secure key entry into the hotel area and I had a business room that was certainly different than any other Iâ€™ve experienced. It was on the ground floor and featured 2-story windows that looked right out onto the busy street at the back of the hotel. Great for people-watching and I was afraid it would be loud at night, but to my surprise sleeping was no problem. Perhaps thatâ€™s because the bed was up a steep 12-stair staircase (see the pics)! The bed and the TV were upstairs, while everything else (desk, chairs, mini bar, bathroom, etc.) were downstairs. Quite odd and it required me to have all my senses when heading to the loo at night, but I became quite fond of the â€œsanctuaryâ€� feel. Nice comfortable bed and nice staff. Overall very decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: dmstcptl
Reviews.Content: After reading the past listings here, I had great concerns about booking Hotel Terminus. We brought ear plugs for the church bells, though we did not have to use them. We took other precautions to protect valuables, etc., however a secured locked door separates the lobby from the rooms, your electronic room key card opens the door. The Hotel provides a free in room safe for your use, and you set your personal combination. Our stay in triple room 218 was near perfect. Two double beds are side by side, and a sofa bed (not very comfortable) are in the room. The only negative issue was no housekeeping service the second day, upon reporting this to the front desk; they acknowledged that a few of the rooms had not been cared for that day; they apologized, and brought clean towels to our room right away. The room was large enough for us not to get in each others way, and the bathroom was also a good size, with bathtub and shower combination. The room when we arrived was very clean, all 3 of us was very pleasantly surprised about the whole experience. The staff spoke very good English, and was very friendly, and honest. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good,clean & central”
Reviews.Author: Rooeyred
Reviews.Content: I booked before I read the negative reviews & was a bit concerned but I was very pleasantly surprised.This hotel is so much better than some of the others I've stayed in in Amsterdam. I had a superior room which,although wasn't massive it was clean and comfortable and the bathroom was the same. I found the staff very helpful and pleasant and the bar/lounge/lobby area was great for relaxing with a drink. If you want a hotel that is right in the middle of all the fun of Amsterdam,convenient for Central station & is safe and comfortable without breaking the bank then the hotel Terminus is for you :)

Reviews.Title: “I liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Vered78
Reviews.Content: The Terminus hotel The location of the hotel is great (60 seconds by foot from the Dam square). It is not far from the red light district, yet it feels safe to hang around since there is a police station right around the corner. The hotel is very nice, and clean. As far as service and facilities; I have only compliments: the staff is very friendly and helping, the rooms are small and clean (though I can't promise you will have any special view from the windows); the bathrooms are clean also and surprisingly bigger then the entire room itself. You will be asked to give 100 euro as a deposit or alternatively to give your international visa number. Bottom line: I liked it!

Reviews.Title: “It's Amsterdam, after all”
Reviews.Author: cfhalliday
Reviews.Content: Despite negative reviews I went ahead and booked a 3 night stay as a surprise Valentine's treat for my wife (brave or what?)All things considered, I have to say we did enjoy our stay. The reception staff were very courteous, friendly and helpful. The breakfast was continental buffet but there was plenty of choice and plenty of it. The noise from the street can be instrusive but hey...if you want peace and quiet then go to Iceland. Be warned however that Stone's Cafe just up the street stays open until 3 am in the morning and when their clientele leave...look out! And of course there was the bells of the church that strike the hour, half-hour AND the quarter-hour. Just as well there is so much to do in Amsterdam that we both returned to our room totally exhausted at the end of each day and so we were only occasionally disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Terminus is top!”
Reviews.Author: shardlojik
Reviews.Content: Just had a very enjoyable weekend staying in Hotel Terminus. Was in a triple room (219) which had lots of space and was very warm. Slight downside as it was for three blokes and there was one single bed (I got that one!) and a double. So you may want to specify single beds if you need a triple room! Didn't notice the bells that much, though I was wearing earplugs as not to hear the snoring that was going on elsewhere in the room. And as noted elsewhere, watch the step up to the bathroom! Staff were nice and friendly and spoke perfect English. The breakfast room is a bit on the small side, so you may want to try and get there before everyone else. You may also want to check out before everyone else as it can get a bit cramped in the lobby and they can only really get 2 people behind the desk. This hotel is light-years better than other places I've stayed in Amsterdam and is 5 mins walk from the train station and Dam square. It's also right round the corner from the red light district and its various trappings.

Reviews.Title: “What are they on about?”
Reviews.Author: HampshireLangdown
Reviews.Content: Booked the Hotel before reading trip advisor and read some damming reports. Felt rather concerned as I was travelling with my wife and 5 kids. Booked 2 - 4 bed rooms. One on the ground floor and one on the first floor. First floor is non-smoking however there was a slight taint of smoke in our room but by no means bad. Rooms very clean and beds made every day. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast good and plenty of it. Noise - of course there is noise - this is a bustling City - what do you expect! If you want to get away from noise - go to the lake district!! The bells and music and the odd drunk making their way home is part of city life. Very close to the Red Light District - but a real experience for my teenage boys. Its not sleezy unless you want it to be. Great shopping - but for a bit of advice - take your wife's credit card away! Kids loved it - ages 7, 10, 14, 15, 16. they all now know what a prostitue looks like and the smell of marijuana eminating from the Coffee Shops throughout the city. This is not the Ritz, nor is it Ritz prices. With a big family this is great value for money and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Read your reviews after booking the Terminus and were a little concerned. The location was fab and hardly walked anywere as biked it or went on the trams. Although the room was small the hotel was clean and the staff very freindly and helpful. The lounge area was comfortable and the breakfast great. We stayed in room 102, not to be advised as yes you could hear the church bells. I still feel we got value for money and would return to the Terminus if guaranteed a large quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “what a disaster”
Reviews.Author: worksopray
Reviews.Content: Stayed atTerminus for 4 nights. First night did not sleep until 5am for the noise from the street and the church bells. Second night returned to bedroom at midnight to find room door smashed in and all belongings gone. Fortunately the thief who had broken into four bedrooms was apprehended. Asked to see manager as thief had managed to enter locked doors of hotel, go past reception and through locked doors to bedroom passage. Never did see Manager. Saw Asst. Manager at end of stay who just said that these things happen. The stay was a complete disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Oh My God”
Reviews.Author: E_Hemingway
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. location is good, right next to Damn square and the clock tower that chimes every hour, one chime for each hour. Midnight is a real treat. Had dirty towels that had hair on them. Called reception to be told i had to go down there (4 flights of stairs, no lift) to get clean ones. Shower has no curtain in ugly bathroom so don't keep anything in there you don't want getting wet. Bill Bryson in his book Neither Here Nor There gave a similar review. Unfortunatley I read it after I had stayed there. Very ugly and depressing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terminus Hotel, centrum.”
Reviews.Author: harry.tora
Reviews.Content: Whilst in amsterdam, i pre booked at the terminus hotel, from Australia. Not knowing what to except, 3 stars, however 3 stars in Amsterdam, is considered by european standards well above average, eqall to 5 stars in Aus. This i soon realized, our money, once your there, is worth plenty. Clothes Italian, french, Rolex, etc, buy there and your laughing. also the Red Light Area, is only 1 street away. Nightclubs, rave, coffe shops, 585 all up. RE; have a good time, keep energy levels up as people have a peroid of falling foul of exaustion, due to climate, etc. I totally reccomend this Hotel, staff courteus, English speaking ,multi-lingual. cable,tel, heating, pretty much all you will need to enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “A bit Pants”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place is a disgrace!! Stayed there in Feb 2005 and it was the worst hotel ever. The room was very small and had the most uncomfortable beds ever, like sleeping on a bag of stones. There was a nasy smell all around the hotel (Smelt a lot like a KenRay). There was a very seedy gentleman named Richard Fitch loitering around the lobby and reception all the time. He was constantly waving a handfull of Euros at all the guests demanding a good time (apparently he's there most days). I recommend checking out and sleeping on the streets by the canal instead.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay at the Terminus Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms, friendly staff. I think the negative reviews on this site must be from people who stayed in the cheaper rooms. It's worth spending a few extra euros on the rooms with full bathroom which we did this week for our second stay at the Terminus. We don't bother with the hotel breakfast included in the price as it's just standard continental. The church bells didn't bother us at all and the room was nice and warm (room 214). This is now our 'Amsterdam' hotel of choice, primarily for it's location, but everything else about the hotel has always been fine for us. Of course there are better hotels in Amsterdam, but you'll pay more for them.

HotelInfo.Name: Tulip Inn Amsterdam Centre
HotelInfo.Address: Beursstraat 11 - 19, Amsterdam 1012 JT, The Netherlands (Formerly Hotel Terminus)
